column1: Modern C++ Programming : Classes, Templates, Design Patterns ; with 397 Listings ¤ C++ is an object-oriented programming language, but generic programming using parameterizable classes or templates is increasingly gaining importance, as this method has great advantages over object-oriented programming when it comes to writing reusable code. This book provides a comprehensive presentation of modern C++ programming design according to the ANSI/ISO standard. The author first provides a compact repertoire of basic language elements of C++ and then explains in detail classical object-oriented modeling as well as modern techniques of generic programming using templates and design patterns. TOC:Preprocessor.- Standard data types.- Pointers.- Arrays.- References.- Type conversion.- Operators.- Function overloading.- Inlining.- Classes.- Attributes.- Methods.- Constructors.- Destructors.- Class declaration rules.- Nested types.- Scope operator.- "friend" declarations.- Static methods and attributes.- Inheritance.- Virtual functions and polymorphism.- Multiple inheritance.- Virtual inheritance.- Operator overloading.- Access operators.- The new and delete operators.- Exception handling.- The role of patterns and idioms.- Modularization of a C++ project.- Namespaces.- Generic programming in C++.- Function templates.- Class templates.- Template specialization.- Method templates.- Template strategies.- Aspect-oriented programming.- The C++ Standard Library.- The streams.- The STL.- Containers, iterators, and algorithms.- List.- Vector.- Map.- Container adapters.- Allocators.- The std::string class.- Auto pointers

Math Anxiety Trigger? : Investigations into the Relationship between Dyscalculia and School Anxiety ¤ What problems occur in students in the subject of mathematics and what consequences result from them? Besides fears that not only cause performance problems but partly lead to disturbances of the entire personality, arithmetic difficulties can still lead to significant problems up to complete failure in the subject of mathematics and thus have negative effects on the career path of the affected person in the worst case. The book addresses this problem and investigates the relationship between arithmetic weakness and school anxiety in elementary school students. Both theoretically and empirically, a comprehensive overview is provided

Linear Algebra and Analytic Geometry: A Textbook for Physicists and Mathematicians ¤ The first five chapters of this new textbook correspond in content and method to the standard of a modern lecture on Linear Algebra. The representation is visually and geometrically from the beginning. One arrives at conic sections, projective geometry, the main axis transformation, tensors, Lie algebras, and symplectic groups to the fundamental statements of Linear Algebra over rings. Physicists will find a discussion of quaternions, Pauli matrices, orthogonal and unitary groups, and the Lorentz group. TOC:Common knowledge.- I. Vector spaces.- II. Matrix calculation.- III. The determinant.- IV. Bilinear forms.- V. The Jordan normal form.- VI. Geometry.- VII.Tensor calculation.- VIII. Linear groups and Lie algebras.- IX. Quaternions and orthogonal groups.- X. Rings and modules

Multivariate Statistics in Ecology: An Introduction ¤ Ilona Leyer and Karsten Wesche bring illumination into the labyrinth of data with their introduction to multivariate procedures in ecology. In addition to the relevant statistical foundations, the widely used ordination procedures, classifications, and permutation procedures for testing multivariate relationships in ecology are treated. The methods are explained in a comprehensible manner using example data sets. The book offers an ideal entry into the wide field of multivariate statistics in ecology. It is directed at all those who work with ecological, landscape, and environmental data in their studies and careers. - Essential for university libraries. (3)

Handbook of plastic optics ¤ Optical and optomechanical components made of plastic are at the center of this volume. All stages of the production process from design to materials, equipment, and technologies to quality control are treated. A indispensable work for all experts in optical components in research and development
Big History : the History of the World - from the Big Bang to the Future of Humanity ¤ Within the new field of

Attack on Freedom: Security Madness, Surveillance State, and the Erosion of Civil Rights ¤ Intrusions into privacy and personal freedom are documented and evaluated. A polemical text that aims to awaken citizens, sharpen their awareness of what is being concocted in their own country or in the EU to restrict fundamental rights, extend and exploit surveillance of all, and see how far authorities can go with their zeal without causing offense. The authors were previously booked for literature and travel, so perhaps the feuilleton will now also deal with the topic or at least with the new book. There have already been condescending criticisms in newspapers: a sign of the bad conscience of journalists who did not take care of themselves. Those who did not read "Time" may have thought that only some US lawyers approved of torture, now everyone can see that German constitutional law professors hold similar theses. The press did not show itself to be shocked on the front pages. Juli Zeh does not only write novels, she has a complete and thorough legal education, which benefits the text. - 30 pages of notes, they are online expanded, but unfortunately without references to the text. (1) (Martin A. Lobeck)

Photovoltaics : Textbook on Fundamentals, Technology, and Practice : with 294 Images and 34 Tables ¤ Systematic, primarily suitable for students, engineers, and technicians, also limited for laymen, introduction that ranges from fundamental prerequisites over semiconductor physics and technology to practical application. Also suitable for self-study

The Power of Encouragement : Foundations and Examples for Help and Self-Help ¤ Third revised edition of the specialist book on self- and foreign encouragement in the psychological, therapeutic and pedagogical environment. According to the foreword, numerous necessary updates, additions and expansions have been made. In this edition, a more precise distinction is made between praise and encouragement, and specific guidelines for their application in the pedagogical field have been added. In addition, findings from modern teaching and learning research as well as empathy and cooperation research have been incorporated. Furthermore, recommended as an inspiring specialist book at a high level for professional helpers and well-educated laypeople. Previous editions may be outdated. For expanded psychology collections

Economic Fallacies : 50 Errors in Thought that Cost us Head and Neck ¤ The long-time editor at the "manager magazine" deals with current economic policy issues in his books (cf. most recently "Euro-Vision", ID-G 44/12). This also applies to this same-named sequel to H. Müller: "Economic Fallacies" (ID-A 12/04). As such, the well-known economic journalist explains the theses of growth skeptics, who have been predicting the end of growth since the report to the Club of Rome. He then examines widespread views on the topics of work, markets, society, globalization, and Europe. Readers will agree or disagree with his theses in different ways. In any case, these animate to own engagement with important and much-discussed economic issues of the time, as Müller strikes a serious argumentation "a path through the jungle of judgments and prejudices" - as he formulates it. He captures the changed economic situation since his 1st title, with its causes and possible consequences, in a clear and readable manner. Current, highly recommended. (2)

Fluid Mechanics : Introductory Textbook ¤ This textbook was specifically developed for students of mechanical engineering and process engineering at universities of applied sciences. It covers, among other things, - the important calculation of pressure loss in the flow of liquid/gas mixtures in pipes - the critical flow of gases and liquid/gas mixtures - the flow of compressible fluids at high speeds (Fanno line) - friction pressure losses in cross-flowed pipe bundles - simple basics of numerical solution methods - examples created in Mathcad that can be retrieved from the internet. The structure of the book is oriented towards the excellent American textbooks and is characterized by a practice-oriented, clearly structured and systematic presentation. Numerous worked-out examples facilitate understanding. TOC:Introduction and Basics.- Stationary Fluids.- Moving Fluids.- Energy Conservation Law.- Impulse Law.- Friction Pressure Losses in Incompressible Fluids in Pipes.- Pressure Loss in Pipe Elements.- Flow of Compressible Fluids.- Flow of Gas/Liquid Mixtures.- Surrounded Bodies.- Introduction to Numerical Solution Methods.- Flow Measurement Technology.- Appendix.- Index.- References

Modular protein domains ¤ To fully grasp the functionality of a protein, one must understand its interactions with other proteins. This unique reference work encompasses all relevant protein domains (SH2, SH3, PDZ, WW, PTB, EH, PH, and PX). The material has been sensibly selected, organized, and provided with references, making it easy to quickly find desired information. A special chapter presents tools and relevant databases, which can be downloaded for free from the internet. Essential for all who investigate protein interactions in vivo or in silico (on the computer) or are involved in proteomics

Facebook - Marketing among Friends : Dialogue instead of Blunt Advertising ¤ Advertising on and with Facebook, a guide for small and medium-sized enterprises, with many examples of successful strategies and campaigns

Handbook of Child and Youth Welfare ¤ This completely revised and supplemented with a series of new current contributions new edition of the Handbook of Child and Youth Welfare brings together the spectrum of pedagogical, institutional, and social policy discussions and perspectives in child and youth welfare at the beginning of the 21st century. Child and youth welfare now includes differentiated offers, programs, and intervention strategies as well as social support policies that do not only refer to children and young people in crisis situations or socially neglected living conditions. It is also an elementary socialization and education institution that shapes childhood and youth in our society socially. The completely revised and supplemented handbook provides not only an overview of the tasks and fields of work of child and youth welfare, but also addresses above all current social and political questions and societal developments that determine and challenge childhood and youth. In the individual contributions, suggestions are given and trends of development are shown that will shape child and youth welfare in the future. It becomes clear that child and youth welfare must be considered and asserted as an independent social and educational policy regulation and design form. The Handbook of Child and Youth Welfare thus brings together the entire spectrum of pedagogical, institutional, and social policy discussions and perspectives in child and youth welfare at the beginning of the 21st century. It is directed at all those who engage in child and youth welfare.

IT in General Education Schools: Subject Matter and Infrastructure; Evaluation of International Empirical Studies and Literature Analysis ¤ The continuously evolving information and communication technologies (IuK) are drivers of an unprecedented structural change: They increasingly penetrate and shape our communication, economic action, and social interactions. In the context of the educational system, one must therefore address the question of what role IuK should play in practical teaching and in the educational content of schools. Against this background, the present working report provides a comprehensive analysis of the various facets of IuK in the context of general education schools. To this end, a structuring framework for school IuK educational content is first developed. Furthermore, a comprehensive evaluation of previous empirical studies and literature sources is carried out. The analysis focuses on the current role of IuK resources and educational content in German schools and supplements this picture - where possible - with a comparison with other industrial nations. Finally, general recommendations for the orientation of IuK education at schools are derived and research needs are shown.

The Book of Need and Doing ¤ Rez.: The non-fiction book illuminates in text and illustrations numerous aspects of animal digestion and its end product, feces. Topics covered include: Why digestion?, Form, Consistency, Color of feces, Use as food, Fuel, Building material, Message transmission, Recycling of nutrients, for the dissemination of seeds and much more. A well-understandable, detailed text page in casual language is accompanied by a full-page, witty, reminiscent of children's drawings illustration - sometimes with speech bubbles or keywords - on the opposite page. In addition, there are smaller illustrations in the text. The conclusion is formed by a "Hitlist" of some facts and a glossary of the text. After "So a Poo", BA 11/05, which also deals with human digestion, but is aimed at younger readers, and the picture books "From the little mole ..." (BA 8/01) and "I have to go, urgently" (BA 12/03) the only comprehensive book for older readers on the subject. Recommended for all. Transformationsmanagement for a Sustainable Water Economy : Handbook for the Realization of New-Generation Infrastructure Solutions in the Field of Water and Wastewater ; [Results of the Research Consortium netWORKS] ¤ The transformation - the change - of urban technical systems of water supply and wastewater disposal is the subject of this volume. In the sense of an energy- and resource-efficient urban development, it is necessary to raise existing potential in energy and material resources. If this transformation is successful, the urban water infrastructure will be more decentralized and closely linked to the energy infrastructure (especially heat supply) in the future. It will consist of numerous modules, focus on the closure of material cycles, and be able to react more flexibly to changing environmental conditions. It will mainly affect the level of individual households or buildings, as well as the level of individual blocks, and have consequences for building technology and building equipment. The publication of the research consortium netWORKS is aimed at decision-makers from the fields of urban development, urban planning, and urban water management. Responsible planners are given a concept for a multi-dimensional evaluation of possible transformation strategies.

Exclusion in the Market Society ¤ The book analyzes the exclusion processes of the present. In addition to the theoretical and conceptual classification, concrete empirical works on excluding social processes are also shown.

Flexible Work : Temporary Work, Contract Work, Outsourcing ¤ Our way of working has fundamentally changed over the last 20 years, yet our understanding of work has remained the same. Modern work models such as freelance work or project work are still considered "atypical" today. This book provides an overview of possible forms of flexibility in personnel deployment that meet the current demands of companies and employees. It describes the legal framework and collective agreements. Contents: Fields of employment and possible uses of different work models. Calculations of costs and benefits of different employment relationships. Expansion of the scope of action through flexible personnel deployment. Practical representation with checklists and contract templates. With the new law against abuse of temporary work and contract work. Online working aids:(Publisher's text)

Management : Learn from the Best ¤ The author conveys the essential aspects of management, i.e. management of organizations, innovations and people, based on the strengths of 60 personalities from society, economy, science, culture and politics

Introduction to Mechatronics ¤ In recent years, the increasingly stronger penetration of mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and computer science has led to the formation of a new discipline, mechatronics. In this interdisciplinary field of engineering sciences, independent fields such as design engineering, technical dynamics, modeling, measurement, control, and regulation engineering, drive engineering, microprocessor engineering, and computer science come together. After an overview of the affected areas of this discipline, the interconnection of the areas in typical mechatronic products is presented using examples

Handbook for Technical Product Design: Material and Manufacturing; Decision-Making Foundations for Designers and Engineers ¤ At the interface between product development/design and engineering, communication and cooperation deficits sometimes occur, which can significantly negatively affect the efficiency and quality of development and innovation processes. The causes include, among other things, competence gaps regarding technical relationships on the part of design professions and creative service providers. Corresponding specialized literature, in which basic technical know-how is prepared and conveyed across disciplines based on the semantics and potential of designers, is not yet available on the market. The present book aims to close this gap. In development processes, frequently used technical knowledge about materials and possible processing methods is presented in a clear and scientifically founded manner in the form of a comprehensive reference work, in a way that addresses and supports the way of thinking of designers/engineers and representatives of design professions. Through a corresponding form of presentation, it should be possible to inform oneself quickly and comprehensively about the most important technological framework conditions for a design. In this process, visual and intuitive reading aids have been introduced, and the knowledge components within the book have been linked to each other. TOC:Introduction: History of mass production.- Selected products and their manufacture.- Materials.- Processing methods.- Restrictive design.- Basics of various disciplines.- Cost accounting & business administration.- Design theory.- Dictionary.- Library of materials and their surfaces, company register.- References.

Adoption - a new life perspective for the child? : Adoptive families in focus ¤ Adoption is taking on an increasingly greater importance in our society. As the number of unwanted childless couples in Western countries continues to rise, adoption is more in demand than ever as a means of fulfilling the desire for children. The dream of an intact family life with one's own child is to be realized in this way. But why do adoptions seem to fail again and again? How can the high proportion of adoptive children in therapeutic institutions be explained? Why do adoptive families need so much help and support? Are adoptions as a measure of youth welfare even sensible? Answers to these and other questions are given in this book. In this, the legal provisions of the adoption procedure are dealt with, adoptive applicants are examined in more detail in terms of their suitability, and positive and negative factors on the part of adoptive parents, the adoption agency, and the adoptive child are revealed, which can lead to the success or failure of an adoption.

Bugatti : Passenger and Racing Cars since 1910 ¤ Provides an overview of passenger and racing cars of the renowned company from 1909 onwards. Roughly chronologically arranged by type, with systematic short descriptions, data tables, black-and-white and colour photos. Affordable compilation for a broad enthusiast circle. Suitable as a replacement for "Bugatti" (ID 28/91), "Bugatti" (ID 3/92, both no longer quite up-to-date) and for J. Kurz (ID 21/05), who sheds more light on the company and family history. (2)

Parliamentarism: An Introduction ¤ The established political science textbook, which is not only institutional knowledge but also deals with individual policy fields in depth, is now available in its 3rd edition. A short, summarizing intermediate part is omitted, and the Europeanization of the political system receives its own chapter. The large amount of material and the author's engaged, problem-conscious approach, who teaches in Heidelberg, sets this title apart. Not suitable for students. For the student audience before the comparable title by W. Rudzio. (2)
This is Our House: A History of House Occupation ¤ Cliff Notes: When the revolution didn't happen, and the students' joyful resistance against their parents'

Niedersächsisches Polizeirecht : for Study, Examination and Practice ¤ This teaching and learning book contains for the first time in Lower Saxony a complete representation of the Lower Saxony Hazard Prevention Law in all relevant connections. The authors explain systematically all the empowerment bases that enable police and administrative interventions.

Space Knowledge ¤ Illustrated, entertaining, and engaging overview of the most important areas of space travel. Reichl and Koç focus their attention not only on history, scientific foundations, and technology, but also on topics such as space travel as an economic factor, cost-benefit ratio, private space projects, space tourism, and emerging space nations like China, Japan, and India. A detailed table of contents, summaries of important data, and an appendix with statistics make the book very clear and also useful for quick fact-finding. The two authors are/were long-time employees of the European aerospace conglomerate EADS and have already published a lot of literature on astronomy and space travel (cf. Koç: ID 13/05). A current and successful book on the subject, worth its price - also very suitable for student presentations. Highly recommended before W. Engelhardt (ID 29/01) and alongside the topic brochure for secondary level I (ID 25/05) and the brief representation by G. Siefarth (ID 23/01). (1)

Activities for Language Promotion ¤ This title for language promotion provides basic knowledge on language acquisition in general, language acquisition of multilingual children, and the prerequisites for literacy acquisition. However, the majority of the content consists of language promotion ideas with specific goals such as expanding the vocabulary, improving communication readiness, promoting pronunciation, and multilingualism. The individual measures are presented in an overview form, each on a single page. The focus of the entire booklet lies on individual and targeted promotion. In the appendix, you will find tables on individual topics that present the basics in a compressed form. A particularly recommended title for the preschool area due to the structured presentation for practice. Prior to Ariane Willikonsky: "Praxisbuch Sprachentwicklung und Sprachförderung" (ID 13/10, also for parents), Johannes Merkel: "Weisst du was, sprechen macht Spass" (BA 7/10), Bernd Groot-Wilken: "Sprachförderung durch Projektarbeit" (ID 24/10). (2)

Foundations of Functional Analysis ¤ In this book, you will find the foundations of functional analysis, which were developed in the first third of the 20th century. Starting from concrete questions of analysis, you will learn methods for investigating linear operators between Hilbert spaces and Banach spaces and apply them to Fourier series, linear integral and differential equations, and in quantum mechanics. The book is an excellent companion to an introductory lecture on functional analysis and also suitable for self-study. It is very comprehensive and easy to understand, with concepts and results illustrated by numerous examples and illustrations. You can test your understanding of the material through many exercise problems, and develop it further independently through others. Solutions can be found on the book's website at www.springer.de. You only need to have 'Analysis I', foundations of linear algebra and topology of metric spaces, and familiarity with Lebesgue integrals. If needed, you can refresh many of these prerequisites through the extensive appendix. For the present second edition, the work has been thoroughly reviewed to expand some topics and further improve the didactic presentation, especially through more detailed elaborations of many arguments.

PORTAL GREEN : Development of a Power-to-Gas Guide for the Integration of Renewable Energies ¤ Storing electricity from renewable energies as hydrogen and using it in a variety of ways: Behind the term Power-to-Gas lies an important technology to achieve climate goals. However, inconsistent guidelines and a lack of experience with the new application cause headaches for those responsible when planning and putting Power-to-Gas plants into operation. Researchers in the Portal Green project offer a guide as a decision-making aid for free download. This guide is intended to serve companies and authorities as a guide, assistance, orientation, and aid, which procedures and laws to observe when they want to build and operate Power-to-Gas (German: electricity-to-gas) plants.

Myths about Male Careers and Female Performance ¤ The results of the study presented in the book confirm the thesis of the unequal chances of women and men in the profession due to structural barriers. Unlike the widespread notion that individual performance is the central criterion for professional success, career requirements are only to a very limited extent bound to objective performance criteria. Rather, more general, rather unspoken criteria play a decisive role. These relate to the private living situation and the associated normative conceptions of professional commitment. At the same time, the area of private life and the gender arrangements found there is characterized by complex change processes. However, the normative conceptions of the working world hardly take account of these change processes to this day. As a result, not only is the pronounced inequality of chances for women and men in the profession a consequence, but also the loss of enormous potential in competences, incorporated knowledge, and innovation for companies. Conventional structures have petrified relationships, which in turn have a negative impact on economic dynamics.

Feminist Theory from Africa, Asia, and Latin America ¤ This volume presents feminist concepts and debates from Africa and its diaspora, from Asia and Latin America (e.g. Womanism, Islamic feminisms, post- and decolonial feminisms, ecofeminism) through selected theorists as well as their critical engagement with the feminist theory and gender research received from the West. (Publisher's text)

Feasibility Study: Research Mobility and Innovation ¤ BEGIN The goal of the feasibility study "Research Mobility and Innovation" was to identify data sources and methodological approaches by which the international mobility of researchers with Germany as target and home country can be better recorded and analyzed than hitherto. Such approaches were sought that can provide answers to socially relevant questions regarding knowledge balance, economic balance, effects, and determinants of research mobility and that have the potential to be integrated into a regular reporting system. The feasibility study is divided into five subchapters, whose core results are summarized in this chapter: Definition of content and technical requirements for a reporting system for recording research mobility (Chapter 2), Evaluation of German data sets / sources and empirical research approaches with regard to their possibilities of use as a basis for quantitative studies on research mobility (Chapter 3), Evaluation of international data sets / sources and empirical research approaches with regard to their possibilities of use as a basis for quantitative studies on research mobility (Chapter 4), Comprehensive evaluation of two particularly promising approaches with regard to costs, resource deployment, and risks associated with the respective approach (Chapter 5) and possibilities of linking the reporting system with other information on effects and determinants of research mobility (Chapter 6). END

Lost in the Universe: Why Physics Has Gone Astray ¤ A. Unzicker, a PhD physicist and science journalist, also takes a hard look at the modern scientific establishment in this book. Following up on "From the Big Bang to the Big Bounce" (BA 6/10), which was crowned the "most explosive science book of the year" in 2010, he continues his criticism here. Again, it's about the foundations and basic assumptions of physics, space, time, and mass, as well as atoms, atomic structure on the one hand, and galaxies and the cosmos as a whole on the other. As an outsider, he is "appalled by how many speculations with meaningless calculations flood physics". He strongly advocates for more open research, also pointing out the problem of research funding, because as soon as projects are applied for and approved, it is practically excluded that "a fundamentally new idea is involved". Numerous quotes from the literature support his efforts to promote a more critical science. Finally, he advocates for broad access to all data and urges readers to question the results in open forums. Highly applicable! (2 pages)

Linux, Step by Step : the Great Switcher's Book ¤ With Linux, the user gains the opportunity to acquire a cost-effective, strong, and user-friendly operating system. He is accompanied in the book from his current installation (e.g. Windows) to a functional Linux installation. Not a beginner's book. 1st edition shown in BA 6/03. It is not clear whether an update was made in this 2nd edition. Where not available, acquisition is recommended. (2)

Introduction to Economics ¤ This book is aimed at students of economics, but also at interested parties from other fields and practitioners. It provides an overview of economics with the goal of presenting the most important questions of this discipline and presenting the methods with which one seeks to answer these questions. Above all, it is about awakening the 'economic intuition' in the reader, making the reader familiar with the economic perspectives, and encouraging further engagement with the subject. After a brief overview of the basics of economics, the treatment of micro- and macroeconomic topics is in the foreground. Subsequently, central topics of the theory of economic policy and financial science are examined. TOC: From the content: Basics: Subject and methods of economics.- Basic conditions of economic activity.- Equilibrium tendencies and stability of the market system.- Microeconomics: Preface.- Household theory.- Business theory.- Price theory.- Macroeconomics: Preface.- Money.- Business cycle and domestic product.- Income and employment theory.- Business cycle and growth.- Foreign trade.- Theory of economic policy: Preface.- Task setting and delimitation to economic theory.- Branches and design spaces of economic policy.- Goals, goal hierarchies, and goal relationships in economic policy.- The value judgment dispute.- Goal-medium relationships and instruments of economic policy.- Carriers of economic policy.- The so-called 'Social-economic optimum'.- Financial science: Preface.- Justification of state activities.- Public budget.- Fiscal policy

Friedrich Tabellenbuch - Mechanical Engineering: Continuing Education and Practice; Mathematical Foundations, Technical Physics, Materials Technology, Machine Elements, Technical Communication, Production Technology, Product Organization, Automation Technology, Occupational and Environmental Protection ¤ Rez.: New edition of "Tabellenbuch Metall- und Maschinentechnik" (BA 1/89, must be replaced) with data on mathematical and physical foundations, materials science, machine elements, production technology, product organization, etc. Supplements "Berufsfeld Metalltechnik" from the same series (BA 5/06), in which the metal technology area is treated from the above-mentioned previous edition. With directory of standards and subject index, closely printed, very fact-rich. Suitable for vocational training and practice. (2 pages) New edition of "Tabellenbuch Metall- und Maschinentechnik" (BA 1/89, must be replaced) with data on mathematical and physical foundations, materials science, machine elements, production technology, product organization, etc. Supplements "Berufsfeld Metalltechnik" from the same series (BA 5/06), in which the metal technology area is treated from the above-mentioned previous edition. With directory of standards and subject index, closely printed, very fact-rich. Suitable for vocational training and practice. (2 pages)

Postfossil Society ¤ The energy transition is the societal challenge of our time, but a renunciation of energy from fossil energy carriers has massive consequences: Such a society needs not less but more state, values the land as a resource and location, and becomes more dependent on international energy networks. Postfossil societies require a change in the economic and land-use structure, in the understanding of state and consumption, in the use of new materials and design concepts. They are confronted with new distribution questions and develop new governance patterns. The book offers stimulating considerations and ideas.

Mathematics ¤ Introductory university textbook for first-semester students of non-mathematical disciplines, which stands between the many school mathematics repetition courses and bridge courses (e.g. Peter Dörsam: "Mathematics at the beginning of studies", BA 2/06; W. Poguntke: "No fear of math", BA 1/05) and subject-specific textbooks like that of Manfred Precht: "Mathematics ... for non-mathematicians" (ID 43/06; related problem collection: ID 38/06). The book takes into account all areas of mathematics that are relevant at this level, is held in an engaging style and is very clearly formulated. The individual chapters are also selectively readable when the language of mathematics is sufficiently mastered, so the work can also be used as a compendium. Also suitable for secondary school level II students. The very good equipment with colorful graphics, photos, color-coded mnemonics, examples and practical applications reminds more of schoolbooks than of university textbooks. (2 pages)

FEM : Fundamentals and Applications of the Finite-Element Method in Mechanical and Vehicle Engineering ¤ Textbook on the finite element method with case studies and understanding tasks. Addressed are students of technical disciplines and engineers in practice. (LK/LEV: Junker) The finite element method (the author mixes the English and German spelling) is used in mechanical and vehicle engineering in computer-aided development. The textbook is intended to build a bridge between theory and practice, with an emphasis on making it more understandable. So, numerous formulas and equations are brought into a practical context, and solved case studies and understanding tasks (with results) are intended to facilitate entry into the not exactly simple subject matter. In addition, a glossary and a list of formula symbols as well as an extensive bibliography are included. Compared to the 6th edition last discussed (ID-G 16/06), it has been slightly tightened and carefully updated in the theoretical part. Therefore, it is mainly intended for first-time acquisition or as a replacement for older than the 8th edition. In addition to F. Rieg: "Finite Element Analysis for Engineers" (not discussed here). (3) (LK/LEV: Junker)

Environmental Information Systems ¤ This practical textbook conveys knowledge about Environmental Information Systems (EIS) for students and practitioners from the entire field of computer science, geoscience, and environmental science. The material is conveyed very clearly through numerous examples and illustrations

Statistics for Dummies Problem Collection ¤ 999 problems from descriptive and inductive statistics, later with detailed solution descriptions, are intended to lead to the ability to apply independently and to understand conceptually, without requiring deeper theoretical knowledge. Review (ekz) The tasks lead from calculations of the standard measures of descriptive statistics to special estimation and test procedures of closing statistics. In the more comprehensive 2nd part, the solutions are described in detail; it serves not only for success control, but explains the relationships and terms again thoroughly. Deeper knowledge from probability theory is not required of the reader, even the standard formulas from combinatorics are explained. Some prior knowledge is certainly helpful and necessary, which can be found in earlier titles of this publishing series, for example D. Rumsey: "Statistics II for Dummies". Relevant software for handling larger data sets - which is rarely required here - is handled by F. Brosius: "SPSS 22 for Dummies"; also in this series). (2-3 pages)

Outline of Literary Studies ¤ Already the 2009 edition of the title (not discussed here) shows, apart from a revised layout, various content innovations compared to the 2003 edition discussed here (ID-G 46/03), including references to media and cultural studies; the literature recommendations for 'new Germanists' and the bibliography have also been updated five years ago. Furthermore, R. Schneider's assessment of "... generally understandable and vividly written ... fluid and stimulating to read ... sympathetic, helpful, primarily recommended for beginners ... introduction" still applies. The current reprint has now been changed in the cover and the literature lists have been revised again. In addition, there are supplements in the concluding tip section for students regarding the research of newspaper and internet sources as well as study behavior rules. The 2nd edition should be replaced in any case. (3) (LK/M: Erdmenger) Very up-to-date, comprehensive introduction for German studies students, which also critically examines the subject and should be compulsory reading for the target group. (LK/M: Erdmenger)

Crash Course in Storytelling: Fundamentals and Implementation ¤ Marketing expert Werner T. Fuchs conveys to you in this crash course what storytelling is, which fundamental rules a good story follows, and what to consider at various application sites. Working Scientifically with Word : [from Word 2000 to Word 2003] ¤ Microsoft Word is the most frequently used text processing software in scientific work. Library Science in National Socialism: A Research Status Analysis ¤ This investigation deals with German library science in National Socialism. The central questions are: How did the book burnings in May 1933 come about, who was responsible and how did the actions unfold in detail? With which state regulations did the libraries have to struggle and how did the library staff react? How did the Association of German People's Librarians (VDV) and the Association of German Librarians (VDB) behave regarding the political guidelines? What importance did other library forms have, such as lending libraries, confessional libraries, or libraries in National Socialist concentration camps? Numerous authors have dealt with the various aspects of NS library policy in recent years or decades and have gained new insights. Now, an attempt will be made to depict and analyze the research status on the history of people's libraries and scientific libraries in the Third Reich based on specialist literature. The treatise not only provides a comprehensive overview of the most important publications on this topic. The reader also learns something about the historical framework conditions and can form a comprehensive picture of the effects of cultural policy, in particular library policy, from 1933 to 1945 due to the detailed and vivid depiction of the most important events.

Literature and Multilingualism: A Handbook ¤ The research field of 'Literature and Multilingualism' is currently experiencing a notable surge in international literary and cultural studies, as the analysis of literary multilingualism promises a novel approach to the relationship between literature and phenomena of cultural and social difference. For the Animals, Every Day is Treblinka ¤ From the domestication and enslavement of animals, a direct path leads to industrial mass slaughter. CO2 Pricing, Energy Carrier Prices Reform: Paths to a Cross-Sectoral Market Design ¤ How should the market design be shaped to enable efficient climate protection in Germany and promote sector coupling? A comprehensive CO2 pricing and reform of taxes, levies, and charges are essential components. This statement incorporates the decisions from the Climate Package 2030 and shows options for how the revenue from CO2 pricing can be used to achieve a double dividend for climate protection. The following points are crucial: A uniform and comprehensive CO2 price in Europe forms the core of an efficient and effective market design. It is obvious that the European Emissions Trading System (EU-ETS) should be extended to all sectors by 2030. For the national CO2 pricing in the transport and heat sector, which the federal government has decided on in the Climate Package 2030, Germany should win further member states as partners. Together, they can form a strategic CO2 alliance that, in the best case, leads to an extension of the EU-ETS. The revenue from CO2 pricing can be used to reform the system of taxes, levies, and charges – with the goal of relieving disproportionately heavily burdened energy carriers. This can achieve a double dividend and promote sector coupling. Particularly effective is replacing the EEG levy and reducing the electricity tax. In the transport sector, emissions are currently at the same level as in 1990. A better market design could significantly contribute to solving these climate policy challenges in the transport sector in a targeted and efficient manner. The federal government should initiate a process to develop suitable solutions.

Software Development for Embedded Systems: Fundamentals, Modeling, Quality Assurance ¤ Embedded systems take on complex control and regulation tasks for technical systems. Their functionality is realized through the interaction of special hardware, standard processors, peripherals, and software. Often the focus is on hardware aspects. In fact, software design plays at least an equally important role in designing these systems. This book starts here and provides a good overview of the topic. Classifications and topics such as concurrency, real-time, and real-time operating systems form the fundamentals. Programming embedded systems is explained using C++, Java, and examples from Esterel and Giotto. Selected software design techniques such as statecharts, hybrid systems, UML, and hardware-software co-design are presented in detail. Embedded systems are often used in safety-critical areas. Ensuring software quality is therefore of central importance and forms another important part of the book. Control of Wind Energy through Regional Planning - Yesterday, Today, Tomorrow ¤ This contribution deals with the development of regional planning designations between 2009 and 2014. The evaluation of current draft plans provides further information on the scope of future zoning designations for wind energy. The investigation is based on the data of the BBSR-managed Regional Planning Monitor (ROPLAMO), whose vector data from zoning areas in binding regional plans have been supplemented with vector data of draft plans on the topic of wind energy. This allows for the first time a time series consideration of regional planning designations. Quoted are, inter alia, the judgments of the Federal Administrative Court of 13.12.2012 (Case No. 4 CN 1.11 and 4 CN 2.11), in which the methodological requirements for the planning control of wind energy use in the countryside were further developed, as well as OVG Schleswig-Holstein, 20.01.2015, 1 KN 18/13

Global culture : media, arts, policy, and globalization ¤ For McDonalds, MTV & Co. there is no terra incognita anymore, as these signs of cultural globalization have already penetrated into the last corners of the world. The contributions of the volume investigate how and with what success states, cities, as well as public and private cultural organizations try to intervene in processes of cultural globalization. In the first part, differences and similarities between cultural policies in Europe, the United States, and Asia are asked. Thus, the cultural policy of France, Sweden, and the United States is compared under the aspect of the relationship between private and public cultural funding, and the development of Japanese cultural policy and the orientation towards Western models is presented. The second part is dedicated to the regeneration of depleted cultural resources in cities that had suffered economic losses. Thus, the effect of a cultural and economic upswing through the establishment of new museums in cities such as Liverpool, Marseille, and Barcelona is investigated. Another contribution analyzes the positive effect of globalization on local music traditions, as can be seen in Brazil, for example. The third part shows, using the examples of Singapore and Ferrara, how cultural policy can contribute to a change in the image of cities. The fourth part finally asks, using examples of American and Japanese television productions, for criteria by which local television series are exported to foreign cultures. (ifa)

ecoControl : Design and Implementation of a Software for Optimizing Heterogeneous Energy Systems in Multi-Family Houses ¤ A decentralized energy supply is the first step towards an energy transition. In this context, various power and heat generators are increasingly being used in multi-family houses. In particular, in Germany, block heat and power plants are increasingly being used in this context, as they can convert gas very efficiently into heat and power. In addition, they enable a continuous and decentralized energy supply in combination with other energy systems such as photovoltaic systems. When operating different energy systems, it is desirable that the systems work in sync with each other. However, it is currently difficult to operate heterogeneous energy systems efficiently together. As a result, potential savings are left unused. A central control can therefore improve the efficiency of the overall system. With ecoControl, we present an expandable prototype that optimizes the cooperation of energy systems and takes environmental factors into account. The software provides a uniform interface for configuring all systems. In addition, it offers the possibility of developing, testing, and executing optimization algorithms using a programming interface. Within such algorithms, predictions provided by ecoControl can be used. These predictions are based on the individual behavior of each energy system, weather forecasts, and energy consumption forecasts. Using a simulation, technicians can immediately test different configurations and optimizations without having to test them over a long period on real devices. ecoControl also helps housing associations and landlords with the management and analysis of energy costs. We have shown through case studies that optimization algorithms that improve the use of heat storage can significantly improve the efficiency of the overall system. Finally, we conclude that ecoControl must be tested under real conditions as soon as a suitable hardware component is available. Through this interface, measurement values are sent to ecoControl and control signals are forwarded to the devices.

Fortress City Cologne : the Bulwark in the West ¤ The work edited by Henriette Meynen contains contributions from twelve authors: - - Bernd von der Felsen, Dieter Klein-Meynen, Andreas Kupka, Henriette Meynen, Helmut Pflüger, Jens Rohde, Rudolf Schmidt, Peter Sievert, Martin Turck, Michael Vollert, Bernhard Wacker, Uwe Zinnow. - - In line with the orientation of Fortis Colonia, the topic of "Fortress City Cologne" encompasses numerous facets. Not only is the history, the construction, and the design of the Cologne fortress with its entire infrastructure described, but also social aspects, the classification of Cologne buildings in general style history, as well as the impact of the fortress on the current urban structure. - - This is not only presented in words, but also in illustrations, with historical as well as more recent photos and plans, the detailed shape and function of the fortress facilities are generally made understandable. In numerous historical maps, as well as an attached current map, the locations of military buildings and facilities from the time of 1815 to 1918 are entered. - - A first standard work on the Prussian fortress city of Cologne is thus available. - (www.fortis-colonia.de)

Introduction to Intercultural Systemic Counseling and Therapy ¤ Thomas Hegemann and Cornelia Oestereich introduce in this introduction compact and clearly the basics and peculiarities of intercultural systemic work. After an introduction to the basics of social anthropology and medical ethnology, they describe the political and social framework conditions for intercultural practice. The largest part takes up examples from the counseling or therapeutic practice of the author team. They illustrate a broad range of counseling methods for psychosocial work with people with a migration background, from overcoming language barriers to working in emotionally stressful situations. A comprehensive bibliography and proposals for practice guidelines conclude the introduction.

The work is designed so that no programming knowledge is necessary for the realization of a Mambo website. We Make Music : A Suggestion ¤ The father, a pioneer of early shellac culture, brings the Berlin dance and variety orchestras to the ODEON recording studio in the 1920s and 1930s. Later, in the post-war period, he brings a new black disc from the city every evening, from which loud music sounds to the daughter's horror. The father appears to her as a magician who can compress opera singers, pianists, and entire orchestras into the small format of a record. Nothing interests the daughter more than finding out what it's all about with the mysterious, paternal world of music. That's why she takes piano lessons, studies with her father's couplets and small dances, and tries to become a child star, but fails in a quirky way with each of these attempts. She must therefore come up with something else. \

Design Dictionary : Conceptual Perspectives of Design ¤ This standard reference work is aimed at professionals in the fields of design, advertising, and marketing, as well as "design fans": 100 international authors explain 260 terms. (Bettina Scheurer) This book fills a gap. The often meager glossaries at the end of more extensive design picture books help the reader with orientation, but they always remain on the surface - which is not something that can be blamed. This book goes deeper, it extracts, explains, and establishes connections. 100 international authors have worked on 260 terms around design and marketing relevant to design. The result is a standard work that deserves this title. So even some technical jargon loses its frightening aspect. From "Added Value" to "Target Group" - no question remains unanswered. This scientific reference work is suitable for both a professional audience and as an interesting book for design fans. It is certainly already possible for smaller collections as a solid basic equipment. (1 A) (Bettina Scheurer)

A Small Theology of the New Testament ¤ A clearly and understandably written introduction to the New Testament. This overall view enables the reader to better recognize and understand the individual writings and scriptural groups. A good help for individual readers and group work.

Entertainment Cities : Entertainment Culture and Urban Development ¤ Western inner cities increasingly give the impression of being controlled Playscapes, designed like theme parks and shopping malls to maximize pleasure and profit. ... Therefore, the book Entertainment Cities looks at current urban transformations in the USA, Europe, and the Emirates with fundamental ambivalence. It locates current trends in social contexts and analyzes the variations of public space as precarious experiments in terms of privatization, commercialization, and feminization.

Understanding Learning Processes : Ways of a New (Special-)Pedagogical Diagnosis ; a Handbook ¤ From a scientific and school-practical perspective, the handbook documents the departure from special pedagogical-deficit-oriented diagnostics. Ways to individual help within the framework of learning process analysis are presented. Most federal states have reacted to the change in pedagogical diagnostics, among other things, with school law innovations. The traditional special school examination is increasingly being replaced by support committee procedures. This change is based on a fundamental shift from a attributive and thus stigmatizing to a ability- and support-oriented pedagogical diagnostics. The child environment, self-organization, and the process character of learning are taken into account both at the entrance and through learning process analysis. Traditional test procedures are pushed into the background. A holistic view is made fairer for students.

Microeconomics Step by Step ¤ This book makes it easy for you: It leads you step by step into the microeconomic way of thinking. Ocean circulation and climate: observing and modelling the global ocean ¤ Ocean circulation and climate: "observing and modelling the global ocean" presents the findings of leading scientists on the knowledge of global ocean circulation after the completion of the "World Ocean Circulation Experiments (WOCE)" investigation phase. WOCE's physical and chemical measurements combined with satellite height measurements have created a data set of unprecedented breadth and accuracy. This data set provides the basis for the development of ocean circulation models and combined ocean-atmosphere circulation models, which serve to understand ocean fluctuations and climate fluctuations and project climate changes. The book leads through the analysis, interpretation, modeling, and synthesis of these data. (MOD)

A Report on Different Vibration Analyses Based on Acoustic and Mechanical Measurements ¤ The volume contains a report on different vibration analyses based on acoustic and mechanical measurements. The report covers the following topics: A) Investigations of the strain-dependent damping of the titanium cladding Ti-10V-2Fe-3Al at room temperature B) Acoustic measurements of sound distribution on various organ pipes and on a piano resonator floor using various acoustic detection systems C) Acoustic measurements on board the ferry \

Globalization and its Critics : The Current State of the Globalization Debate ¤ Globalization' has become one of the most frequently used political buzzwords in recent years, although - or perhaps precisely because - the term is still underdetermined, theoretically vague, and often overloaded with (ideological) value judgments. Regardless of this, numerous controversies have arisen - in the wake of the inflationary use of the globalization term. The spectrum of these conflicts is marked on the one hand by 'globalization supporters' and on the other hand by 'globalization critics.' The volume brings together contributions that outline the framework conditions and divergences of the globalization controversy from different perspectives and provide a sociological interpretation of the transnational, international, and national phenomena that accompany it.

Sacred Scriptures: An Introduction ¤ The research of the Sacred Scriptures has brought about significant progress in the last four decades, raised new questions, put previously secured things into question again, and also eliminated uncertainties. The research of the Sacred Scriptures has brought about significant progress in the last four decades, raised new questions, put previously secured things into question again, and also eliminated uncertainties. The present volume presents the state of knowledge achieved in the relevant scientific disciplines under the questions of religious science, in such a way that even the non-expert is able to form an impression of the fullness of the new insights into the Sacred Scriptures. Renowned researchers explain the origin, author, structure, literary characteristics, hermeneutic questions, and addressees as well as the handling of the sacred texts. This is followed by the question of what authority and significance the relevant Sacred Scripture has for the believers of the respective religion. The volume provides a reliable orientation on the Old and New Testament, the Talmud, the Quran, the scriptures of Zoroastrianism, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Taoism, Confucianism, Baha'i, and the New Religions, from the Mormons over Christian Science and the Unification Church to the Community of the Universal Life. An introduction to the canonical and apocryphal texts of the religions of the world, from the great world religions to the newer religious movements.

Physics for Engineers for Dummies : [for the kick with physics ; at a glance: finally understand the mathematical basics ; Mechanics and Thermodynamics quickly grasp ; Optics, Electricity, Atomic, Nuclear, and Solid-State Physics master] ¤ With Mechanics, Thermodynamics, Electromagnetism, Optics, Atomic, Nuclear, and Solid-State Physics, C. Thomsen covers the usual areas in 2-semester introductory courses on the physical foundations of natural and engineering sciences. In addition to engineers, students of natural sciences, teacher candidates, advanced students, and interested laymen can also benefit from the book. Only at a few places do the mathematical requirements exceed the level of the upper secondary school (mostly as part of optional supplementary sections). Physics students will not get by with this volume alone without further specialized literature (e.g. "Modern Physics", ID-G 3/10). The individual sections can be used independently of each other. In contrast to ("Physics for Dummies", ID-G 50/07), the content focuses are more evenly distributed. The literature list and tasks are missing. Instead, the numerous examples in the text are designed as tasks and provided with step-by-step solutions. The colloquial tone may disturb the purists, but it whets the appetite for the subject. (1 S) (Oliver Mitesser) Introduction to Physics for Engineers, students of natural sciences, teacher candidates, advanced students, and interested laymen. (Oliver Mitesser)

The Old Order Amish : a Community of Faith between Perseverance and Development ¤ Publisher's information: The life of the Old Order Amish has hardly changed over the past two centuries. With horse-drawn carriages, old costumes and their antiquated German dialect, they stubbornly deny all developments of the Industrial and Post-Industrial Revolution. Approximately 85,000 people still live in the USA and Canada today according to the strict rules of the most conservative part of the Mennonites. Silke Langwasser provides an overview of the fascinating history of the Old Order Amish. Their origin from the Anabaptist movement and the secession of 1693, their way of life, their reaction to the American Civil War and the world wars of the 20th century are explained by her just as vividly as the social structures that have shown an unusual continuity over the centuries. Religious aspects such as worship, baptism and burial and their importance for the survival of the community are further topics. With a sociological approach to religion, the Germanist and historian succeeds in presenting this extraordinary minority in a largely unbiased manner.

Love : an Exercise ¤ Individuals can be recognized by the fact that they have a bend in their optics. They gain a second meaning from all publicly accessible things and events, which is initially only accessible to themselves. In this highly personal optics, what may be experienced as the slowness of a fellow human being may be attributed to the impatience of the experiencer themselves. This individualized form of experiencing is not particularly consensual. Nevertheless, it can happen that another person, instead of simply shaking their head, inserts themselves into my worldview and even starts to confirm it through their own actions: Instead of accusing me of impatience, they act a bit faster themselves. For the others, my experience is still insignificant, but for the other, it apparently has the power of a strong motivator. So it becomes easier for me to be who I am.
Woman Without Child: Conversations and Stories - A Round Table ¤ Review: A beautiful idea, inviting 12 childless women to a feast and exploring the question

Homer's Wild West: The Historical-Geographical Rebirth of the Odyssey ¤ Heinz Warnecke brings Homer's Odyssey back from 'literary abstraction' into historical reality and thereby initiates a paradigm shift in Homer philology. He resolves, taking into account all the statements of the Homeric epics, the question of Odysseus' homeland island and, on a solid philological basis, shows that Odysseus' fictional journey leads through geographical spaces that lose nothing of their reality in the form of mythologizing narration. Furthermore, the historical findings on the subject matter are groundbreaking for the solution of the Homeric question. Moreover, the historical personality of the Odyssey poet and his homeland can now be reliably fixed. In addition to a wealth of new arguments, Warnecke supplements the second edition with a chapter on the history of the Ithaka question.

Women in the Military : Empirical Findings and Perspectives on the Integration of Women into the Armed Forces ¤ Current studies on the integration of women into the Bundeswehr - Gender relations in male-dominated institutions - Gender relations and war. Mapping gas-bearing sediments in the Mecklenburg Bay ¤ Free, unresolved gas in marine bottom sediments affects their acoustic and geotechnical properties. The penetration of sound waves into the seafloor is prevented. In the Mecklenburg Bay, an area with gas-bearing sediments was repeatedly measured with side-looking sonar and sediment echolot; three measurements were carried out from April 1995 to March 1996. The bay effect has been mapped in its depth and extent.

Elementary Particle Physics : From Fundamentals to Modern Experiments ; with 51 Tables and 88 Exercises with Solution Hints ¤ Elementary Particle Physics. This textbook offers, from the fundamentals to modern experiments, a systematic introduction up to the latest developments in the field. Experimental tools such as accelerators and detectors are discussed at the beginning. Then follow the symmetry principles and their applications. Subsequently, the Standard Model is developed, which largely dominates the current experimental and theoretical discussion. Essential areas of quantum electrodynamics, the quark model, quantum chromodynamics, and the electroweak theory are explained. Latest experimental results on neutrino physics and the violation of CP symmetry are treated, before the question of possible extensions of the Standard Model is raised. The textbook is attractively designed, 83 exercises with solution hints serve for deepening.
