Nietzsche : Biography of his Thinking ¤ Like few others, Friedrich Nietzsche has shaped modern thought. He called himself dynamite. One can imagine his thinking as a laboratory where provocative, sometimes risky arguments are experimented with. His philosophy does not result in a system, but rather lives from its inner dynamics. Rüdiger Safranski called his significant and highly successful Nietzsche book, which appeared on the 100th anniversary of his death and was translated into many languages, a 'biography of his thinking'. On the 175th birthday on October 15, 2019, a new edition of this standard work appears, expanded with an afterword that highlights the unbroken topicality of Nietzsche's thinking.

Holz erkennen und benutzen : das Nachschlagewerk für die Praxis ; [over 200 wood species and their use] ¤ The title is about 30 pages more comprehensive and includes 17 new wood species compared to the previous edition "Holz bestimmen und benutzen". Nevertheless, the edition from 2006 can certainly remain in stock. After a brief introduction to the material wood with drying, cutting, grain and wood defects, 219 wood species, each presented on an A4 page, are listed alphabetically by botanical name. The always similarly structured pages contain a photo of the grain, the text includes the sections Description, Properties, Drying and Stability, Durability (including pests), Use, Origin and Health Risks. Partly supplemented by photos of workpieces. More processing-oriented and comprehensive than the otherwise comparable "Atlas of Wood Species" (ID 17/10). As a more affordable and sufficient material expert for DIYers, "Material Wood" (BA 2/03) is still recommended. (3) (Karin Lehmann) 219 wood species are presented with the important properties for wood craftsmen: grain with photo, processing properties, aging behavior, growth forms, weights, typical uses, all common name variants and possible health risks. (Karin Lehmann)

Russia's Foreign Policy: An Expression of the Search for a New Identity ¤ The report highlights three aspects of Russia's foreign relations: fundamental questions in the search for a new self-understanding, different schools of thought and influence groups, and the priorities of Russia's foreign policy under Yeltsin. The study is based on sources and documents of Russian politics and science and the 'Foundations of the Foreign Policy Concept of the Russian Federation' developed by the Russian Security Council in April 1993. In individual sections, the contribution deals with geopolitical, ideological, political, and politico-cultural questions and addresses various geographically oriented political currents.

Grandfather and the Smugglers ¤ Alone with the grandfather to climb the Three Cave Mountain, the grandchildren find it great. They had already started this mountain tour once, but then the grandfather had broken his leg, and they did not come all the way to the third cave. This time they will make it! But first they discover an abandoned tent and a mysterious map, on which someone has drawn the caves. What does it mean? From the planned hike, it suddenly becomes a dangerous adventure with real smugglers, police, helicopters, wolves, and a bear-like bear. The new children's book by the successful author from Sweden - an exciting adventure story. - What was the grandfather's profession? (Writer). Gabriel sits on a snake. Luckily, it's harmless, because it was a... (Ring-necked snake).

Social Science Data Analysis: An Introduction ¤ Sociology as an empirical experience science deals with the description of the social world and the verification of theoretical mechanisms with the help of statistical procedures. Those who want to understand these works, but also critically discuss them, must bring a minimum of understanding of the procedures of social science data analysis. At the center of the present book is the attempt to convey the corresponding statistical basic knowledge for own analyses. In addition, the readers should be given the tools to critically reflect existing analyses and, if necessary, also fundamentally criticize them.

Archicad Practice : Introduction and Construction Exercise ¤ ArchiCAD is a professional 3-D architecture software, whose free student version is widely distributed at universities. The textbook for ArchiCAD beginners, building planners, and students of architecture and civil engineering deals with the current version ArchiCAD 17 and now appears in 2 volumes (see "ArchiCAD Practice - Reference Book", in this issue). In the present volume, the essential tools and program commands are conveyed in a step-by-step guide and numerous screenshots in a practical and understandable manner, using a continuous exercise - the construction of a single-family house. Equipped throughout with informative illustrations

Marx ¤ No thinker is cited as often and read as little as Karl Marx. With his new introduction, J. Rohbeck, a professor of philosophy in Dresden and specialist in the philosophy of history (most recently

The Industrialization of Banking Operations : How Industry Concepts Can Be Transferred to Banks ¤ For a long time, German banks have been in a crisis. Dieter Bartmann and other leading experts show with which methods the proven models of the industry can be transferred to banks. The industrialization of banks is a new method that is already being taken up by leading institutions. The book provides methodologies for design and implementation at products and processes

Revolution or Evolution: The End of Capitalism? : Conversation with Roman Chlupatý ¤ Social injustice, environmental destruction, and the debt and financial crisis make us question whether the market economy is the right solution to the problems of our time. Bestselling author Tomás Sedlácek ("The Economics of Good and Evil") nonetheless takes up the lance for capitalism: it is the best economic system we know. But it must be fundamentally reformed. David Graeber ("Debt: The First 5,000 Years") argues against this: capitalism is no longer reformable, it must be abolished. Our economy needs a different, fairer system. The stars of capitalism criticism meet and take a pointed stance. (Publisher's text)

Ubuntu 18.04 : Practical Knowledge for New and Experienced Users ¤ The Linux operating system exists in various distributions and derivatives. A very popular derivative is Ubuntu, closely related to the Debian distribution. M. Fischer is the author of a comprehensive handbook on this topic. Troche has written a very concise introduction, which is limited to essential basic knowledge. He has now updated his last title for the Ubuntu version 16.04. The LTS version 18.04 is dealt with, which again receives five years of support with updates. With this new version, the groundbreaking developments of the past few years are abandoned (Desktop system Unity and display manager Mir) and the Gnome/X-Window-Server pair returns for display and management of the work surface. Troche has incorporated corresponding changes. In addition, he has almost all chapters revised and partially expanded. A chapter that contained brief descriptions of Ubuntu programs has been omitted. There is again a DVD supplement for quick installation. Predecessors are still usable (updates until 2021)

Helfen durch Rhythmik : recognizing, understanding, and treating behaviorally disturbed children ¤ The predecessor of this book (ID 7/93), which reached a total of 6 editions, was unfortunately not available for comparison. As the book provides an extensive theoretical discussion of behavioral disturbances and the possibilities of influencing them through rhythmic-musical education, as well as being very practice-oriented and containing more than 150 exercises and songs, it is recommended for broad use - deviating from the previous review. (2) (LK/W: Scharmann)

Supply Chain Management : Fundamentals, Strategies, Instruments, and Controlling ¤ Supply Chain Management has developed into a business field with particularly significant change. Especially, large improvement potentials are suspected in a supply chain. Hartmut Werner shows concrete ways to exploit these optimization possibilities. For this, the fundamentals of supply chain management as well as modern supply-chain strategies are characterized. On this basis, instruments are presented that serve the implementation of the previously discussed strategies. These considerations culminate in a supply chain controlling. The book is very application-oriented designed and relies on a wide range of examples from practice.(Publisher's text)

Taliban : Afghanistan's God Warriors and the Jihad ¤ A depiction of the origin, history, fundamentalism, power, and financial resources of the Taliban. (Elisabeth Mair-Gummermann) Review: Ahmed Rashid, a critical Pakistani journalist, has been reporting on and from Afghanistan for 21 years. Accordingly, his book on the Taliban, these ultra-fundamentalist fighters, is by no means a quick shot, but a thoroughly well-researched, solid, serious, competent, and comprehensive presentation. He reports on the history of the Taliban government and the reasons for their success, on the relationship of the Taliban to Islam and vice versa of Muslims to the Taliban, and (very important, as new perspectives are offered here) the ruthless policy of the great powers around oil and pipelines through Afghanistan (a book on this topic has just appeared in France, causing great commotion). Extensive, informative appendix. (1) (Elisabeth Mair-Gummermann)

Operation and Upgrade of the Neutron Four-Circle Diffractometer TEX-2 at FRG-1 (GKSS Research Center) : Final Report, Completion Date of the Project: 31.3.1995 ¤ Polymorph measurement, Texture analysis, Neutron diffraction, Composite materials, Metals, Alloys, Ores, intermetallic compounds, Rocks

Sociology of Health ¤ Perspectives of health sociology - Foundations of sociological health research - Social structural and cultural influences on illness and health - Social action and health - Health system and health policy - Health care and its evaluation by the population

Sociology from the Beginning : An Introduction to Themes, Results, and Literature ¤ This introduction aims to present 'Sociology from the Beginning'. Sociology deals with society as a product of social action. It begins with the concept of social action and aims at society. It attempts to systematically present the themes or basic concepts of sociology on the way from social action to society: social order, social differentiation, social integration, social structure, social inequality, social mobility, and social change. In addition to these themes, selected results of sociology are presented. Finally, the report on theories and results is supplemented by instructions for personal reading and further literature.

E-World : Technologies for the World of Tomorrow ¤ The development of new information technologies is advancing very quickly. The working world and society will change like never before. The author introduces the most important IT trends of the coming years. He does not remain on the surface, but tries to explain the backgrounds and thus to awaken a better understanding of the consequences that can arise from these developments. Problematic effects are clearly named. The author's core statement is that control over the future E-World is indispensable. Only in this way can it be guaranteed that this E-World remains a human world. Interesting, lively, and easily understandable presentation. Extensive historical references. Partly, the leading employee Frank K., a typical product of the modern, post-capitalist, global economic order, is accompanied in his work and considerations. Helpful general understandable glossary in the scope of 13 pages. Good compilation of further information (also magazine articles and addresses in the World Wide Web). (2)

Mathematical Modeling with MATLAB® : a practical introduction ¤ Dass vorausschauende Prognosen durch mathematische Modelle gestützt werden, erfolgt in sehr unterschiedlichen Bereichen, sei es in der Wirtschaft, bei Wettervorhersagen, in der Kosmologie oder auch nur, um die optimale Flugbahn eines Balles zu bestimmen. Dazu muss eine mathematische Struktur gefunden werden, in der die Ausgangsgrößen und die bestimmenden Naturgesetze interpretiert werden können. Die Resultate mathematischer Prozesse müssen dann wieder in die Realität übersetzt werden. The text introduces the problem with a detailed case study and then deals with the topic generally and fundamentally. The numerical calculations use the routines and possibilities of the MATLAB program system, which is explained again in the appendix. The book is aimed at students in the bachelor's program, who, however, must have some mathematical knowledge, as deeper lying proofs are mostly only hinted at. (3)

Fatherlessness : History and Presence of a Fixed Idea ¤ Fathers are currently in crisis and often preoccupied with finding themselves. The fact that they are out of step in the family role-playing or, as it were,

The House of the Dead : Siberian Exile under the Tsars ¤ Based on extensive studies in Russian archives, this work examines the system of exile under the tsarist regime from 1800-1917 and gives a vivid description and with many eyewitness accounts also a voice to the exiles themselves. Review: The exile 'to Siberia' presented in the German language has finally found a well-founded, scientifically based representation in this multi-award-winning book by the British historian, covering the 19th century until the fall of the tsar in 1917. Alive, with colorful access to the fate of people, Beer describes the system, function, and increasingly dysfunction of the exile system, the endless transports and archaic punishment methods, and gives with many eyewitness accounts a voice to the hordes of people exiled for political or criminal reasons to places like Chita or the island of Sakhalin: the Decembrists, the Polish insurgents of the 1st and the Russian revolutionaries of the 2nd half of the century, and finally the persecuted of the pre-war and war years from 1905 who gradually undermined the system. Two picture parts, maps, bibliography, cross-register. General history by Dittmar Dahlmann: 'Siberia' (Schöningh 2009). - Unrivaled! (2)

Empörung : Novel ¤ He is young, decent, and diligent, he rebels once, and he pays for it with his life. Marcus Messner begins his studies at the conservative College of Winesburg in Ohio in 1951. As the Korean War enters its second year, Marcus experiences a story that deals with inexperience, resistance, sex, courage, and error. Barely is he in college when he encounters a first, completely disturbing experience with a fragile young girl, and he encounters a form of discrimination that enrages him. Against his will, Marcus becomes a rebel, against his fellow students, but also against his father - and he remains stubborn until the bitter end.

Office 2010 for Dummies : [also for Home and Student Edition ; at a glance: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Access expertly use ; stylish layout for documents and presentations ; edit tables, create formulas and analyze data ; configure e-mail accounts and create databases] ¤ In the popular "Dummies" series, two titles appear in parallel to the current Microsoft Office package: a comprehensive "all-in-one" volume by Peter Weverka (in this number) and the present introduction by Wang Wallace (last BA 1/05). Three target groups are addressed: switchers from Office 2007 get a quick overview of the new features, users of older versions such as Office 2003 or XP learn the transition to the menu bar-controlled user interface, and Office newcomers receive an introduction to the most commonly used and useful menus, functions, buttons, commands from Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, and Access. The individual programs cover both the "Home and Business Edition" and the "Home and Student Edition". Formulated in a relaxed and understandable way, with good examples for private or professional use, numerous step-by-step instructions, and informative screenshots. Recommended alongside the two almost identical introductory titles by G. Born (both BA 9/10) and the more affordable practical handbook by G. Philipp (BA 8/10). (2) (Elke Nibbrig) Office newcomers and switchers from older Office versions receive a relaxed introduction to the most commonly used and useful menus, functions, buttons, commands from Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, and Access. (Elke Nibbrig)

Family Policy Concepts in a Cross-National Comparison: Stepping Stone or Obstacle for Working Mothers? ¤ The civic role distribution between the working man and the housekeeping wife no longer corresponds to the self-understanding of progressive industrial societies for decades. There is a broad consensus that the welfare state with its blessings should promote equal burden in profession and family. However, although both political science, economic, and demographic aspects speak against the breadwinner model, it is still being solidified in many places through political regulations. Nadine Stern examines the gender-political effect of German, French, and Swedish family policy. To this end, she presents central family policy regulations against each other. The result is not only country-specific findings. The author rather goes on to ask how financial regulations, childcare and care leave regulations can specifically promote the compatibility of profession and family for men and women.

Foundations of Mechatronics ¤ Teaching and exercise book about the meanwhile well-established new field of knowledge for a broad circle of specialists in study and practice. Compared to the 1st edition 2000 (BA 2/01), it has been expanded by approximately 140 pages and supplemented with new applications. In the appendix, 2 CD-ROMs with full and demo versions of mechatronic element simulations are included; reference addresses are also provided. An exchange of editions is recommended. (2) (LK/N: Pleuß)

Algorithmic Mathematics ¤ Based on a basic lecture, this work provides students of mathematics, preferably in the first semester, a compact introduction to algorithmic mathematics. Review (ekz): With the increasingly presence of high-performance computers, the importance of algorithmic mathematics is constantly increasing. It deals with the design and analysis as well as the implementation of algorithms and the development and investigation of the underlying mathematical structures. The present work, based on an introductory basic lecture, now provides students of mathematics, preferably in the first semester, a compact introduction to algorithmic mathematics. The presentation, equipped with numerous examples and illustrations, conveys the contents in a mathematically sound manner and provides a small introduction to the programming language C++, in which the implementation of numerous algorithms also takes place. Knowledge beyond school knowledge is not necessary. Nevertheless, basic competences in dealing with algorithms and first solid experiences with university mathematics significantly facilitate reading. Very useful for the target group to acquire basic knowledge in the field of algorithmic mathematics. No tasks. (3)

Küpfmüller Theoretical Electrical Engineering : Electromagnetic Fields, Circuits and Electronic Components ¤ What is theoretical electrical engineering? -- Theory of electrical networks -- The electrostatic field -- The electric current field -- The stationary magnetic field -- The quasi-stationary electromagnetic field -- The non-stationary electromagnetic field -- The electromagnetic field in electronic components -- Mathematical fields -- The Laplace Operator

Peace in Chinese : why war threatens in Asia ¤ After Holslag, China is "a normal country with normal ambitions", whose interests, however, "are not in line with the idea of a peaceful rise". The main theses of the book are not original, yet it is a readable analysis of international relations in Asia. Review: Holslag, an expert in international politics at the Free University of Brussels, sees in China a rising country that "pursues normal ambitions and faces the normal dilemmas of war and peace". He foresees tensions and even warns of a war, because China's interests in the region, in his view, "are not in line with the idea of a peaceful rise in a complex Asian environment". This concerns China's strategic goals and those of its powerful neighbors as well as the United States, which still play a key role in Asia. Media-effectively, Holslag claims to offer a completely new look at this complex situation, in reality, his theses are not particularly original (cf. on the subject: Dirk Schmidt: "Foreign Policy and Foreign Trade of the People's Republic of China", 2012; K. Mahbubani: "The Return of Asia", 2009; W. Hirn: "The Next Cold War", 2013; A. Lorenz: "The Asian Revolution", 2011). Nevertheless: as a good overview and a readable analysis of international relations in Asia: (2)

Paths to Technological Fascination: Socialization Trajectories and Intervention Time Points ¤ The empirically designed study is part of the interdisciplinary acatech consortium project „Monitoring of Motivation Concepts for Technological Youngsters (MoMoTech)”. It investigates conditions and prerequisites for developing and promoting technological interest in children and adolescents. The study assumes that there are phases and time points in the socialization process of children and adolescents that are significant for their (technological) socialization. Whether young people begin to be interested in technology depends on various factors that can be described as condition constellations. The study aims to collect and describe such constellations. The study collects three content complexes: skills and abilities required for understanding and dealing with technology, attitudes that influence the view of technology and dealing with it, and socialization factors that promote or hinder interest in technology (with a focus on school and family). With a view to potential intervention time points, it is investigated how relevant technical skills and attitudes change in the socialization process; special interest is given to gender specificity.

Understanding International Politics : An Introduction ¤ Even the 2nd, expanded edition of this university textbook on International Politics can be recommended without restriction. The unusual arrangement, explaining political theories based on current conflicts, greatly facilitates entry into the complex subject matter. Thus, when dealing with the war over Syria, the theory of the 'New Wars' (Mary Kaldor, 2007) is introduced and its analytical and prognostic statement power is checked. With glossaries, exercise questions, extensive literature references, even with relevant film tips! A model work that should be offered in libraries with a student readership. (3)

Semiconductor Components ¤ This textbook, which can be used in addition to lectures (at FHs and universities) or for self-study, contains the basics and applications of components in electronic circuit technology. Numerous examples and sample solutions, as well as extracts from data sheets of selected components on CD-ROM, serve as support. This is new compared to the otherwise more comprehensive previous edition "Electronic Components" by Reisch (ID 6/98), from which the present title is an excerpt. Due to the more favorable price, already for medium-sized libraries. There was otherwise nothing new on the subject in recent times. (2) (LK/W: Weinheimer-Hartmann)

FR, architecture in France ¤ Rez.: Another volume in the new series by the Taschen Publishing House on contemporary architecture by country (already published: "CH - architecture in Switzerland"; BA 9/06, "... in Japan" and "... in the Netherlands", both BA 11/06). Here 15 young and established French architects are presented with a total of 28 buildings created in the past 8 years or still under construction. With large-format exterior and interior views, brief 3-language explanations, introduction to the latest trends in French architecture, as well as short biographies, addresses and websites of the architects. Excellent architectural photography. Also usable as a continuation of "Birkhäuser Architectural Guide France" (ID 1/01). (2) (LK/HL: Ittekkot) Another volume in the new series by the Taschen Publishing House on contemporary architecture by country (already published: "CH - architecture in Switzerland"; BA 9/06, "... in Japan" and "... in the Netherlands", both BA 11/06). Here 15 young and established French architects are presented with a total of 28 buildings created in the past 8 years or still under construction. With large-format exterior and interior views, brief 3-language explanations, introduction to the latest trends in French architecture, as well as short biographies, addresses and websites of the architects. Excellent architectural photography. Also usable as a continuation of "Birkhäuser Architectural Guide France" (ID 1/01). (2) (LK/HL: Ittekkot)

... confronted with death suddenly : a guide for kindergartens with emergency plans, checklists, and aids for bereavement support ¤ Loss, death, and grief are recurring themes in kindergartens and pose a challenge to the pedagogical sensitivity of educators. A practical guide to supporting younger children in their grief. (Birgitta Negel-Täuber) Even small children are already confronted with death, loss, and grief. The way to deal with this in kindergarten daily life varies in intensity, depending on how close the deceased person was to the institution (e.g. the school bus driver, a caregiver dies after a long illness, stillbirth in a child's family). In accordance with the temporal course of grief work, checklists for initial reactions (who is informed?, participation in the funeral?) make a start. Short- and long-term pedagogical support, parent work, and processing of the grief case in the group with many suggestions (songs, rituals, conversations) take up the vast majority of space. A table on possible reactions of children, depending on age, a glossary around the topic of death and burial, and an excursion on burial rituals in other religions round off the practical guide. The only known comparable title is hardly still available anywhere (G. Ennulat: "Supporting children in their grief", BA 1/99), which is why it is recommended more broadly. (2) (Birgitta Negel-Täuber)

The Dictionary of PC Technical Terms with Correct Pronunciation : [all important computer technical terms and abbreviations especially for PC beginners and seniors ; new: terms for Windows 7 and blog language] ¤ In a reader-friendly font, this PC dictionary lists 6,000 current technical terms from the computer environment. (LK/HB: Isigkeit) Updated edition of a PC dictionary that focuses primarily on desktop PCs and laptops. The 6-year-old prequel (BA 12/04) is outdated and should be deleted. For the 6,000-entry work, a larger font was provided to improve readability, and in addition, the English terms received a phonetic supplement. Certainly a concession to the newly named target group of seniors. In addition to these formal improvements, numerous new technical terms have been introduced, including those from the environment of Windows 7 and the blog language. The inconsistency in the selection noted in the prequel is also noticeable in this edition. The appendix provides, in addition to a list of file extensions, a table of top-level domains and a reference called Netlingo with commonly used abbreviations, which appear again and again in the blog, chat, news, and forensic scenes. After the two top dogs Peter Winkler (BA 10/08) and Andreas Voss (BA 12/09) (2 A) (LK/HB: Isigkeit)

Basic Course in Function Theory: An Introduction to Complex Analysis and its Applications; [for Bachelor and Diploma] ¤ Hardly any of the standard lectures at German-speaking universities has remained unchanged in its core for many years like the one on complex analysis, which was clearly shown by the recently published new edition of a nearly 100-year-old lecture notes (H. Weyl: "Introduction to Function Theory", ID 50/08). Of course, the beginnings are now more thoroughly founded, and new application areas have been added. This volume is also characterized by its subtle treatment of algebraic and topological foundations, as well as by the many cross-references shown at the end of each section. However, the central theme remains the study of holomorphic and meromorphic functions with the instrumentarium built on the Cauchy's integral theorem. A substantial final chapter deals with the geometric environment of the Riemann's mapping theorem. Various problems without solutions are inserted. Highly recommended from 2nd year of study. (3)

Mathematics for Life Scientists: Foundations with a Focus on Statistics for the Bachelor ¤ Introduction to mathematics and statistics for the bachelor's and teacher training studies with a focus on biology. Review (ekz): To describe observations and processes in biology quantitatively, the statistical and analytical methods of mathematics are used. Adolf Riede has updated his introductory textbook from 1993 (not shown here) after years of university experience and presents the 2nd edition. More than half of the book is dedicated to statistics. Elements of differential and integral calculus are embedded, which include a repetition of the secondary school material from level II. Despite the step-by-step and example-guided presentation form, the mathematical tone remains. This makes the book particularly relevant, even if elementary, theoretical concepts are of interest, such as in teacher training studies with natural science subject combinations. It can also be used for the biological bachelor. Titles with a stronger practical focus (e.g. "Biostatistics", ID-G 49/12) or with a focus on evaluation software ("Parametric Statistics", can not be replaced in this way. Supplementing at university locations. (3)

Math for Biologists ¤ To be able to plan, conduct, and evaluate a biological experiment correctly, one must have a solid understanding of fundamental mathematical and statistical operations. Math for Biologists provides an easily understandable access to mathematics, statistics, and data processing

Introduction to Mathematical Work ¤ Revised edition of a methodical and content-related introduction to abstract mathematical thinking and working. Review University mathematics differs massively methodically and in terms of content from school mathematics. This induces significant problems at the beginning of the mathematics study. The proven and in a 3rd, revised edition (1st edition: 2009) available introduction to mathematical work originates from the teaching practice of an introductory phase of study. It provides, taking into account the problematic initial situation, preferably first-year mathematics students with a competent methodical and content-related introduction to abstract mathematical thinking and working and conveys, in addition to central basic techniques, conventions, and knowledge for the representation of mathematical facts, also some contents of the 1st study section. With numerous examples and tasks. Very helpful for a successful university entry. References to explanatory videos round off the 3rd edition. Further materials and sample solutions on the internet

How the Locomotive Depot Works ¤ In BA 8/99 the book "The Steam Locomotive in the Locomotive Depot" and in BA 12/01 the title "Diesel- and Electric Locomotives in the Locomotive Depot" (both written by M. U. Kratzsch-Leichsenring) were recommended for purchase. If these two books are available and not yet worn out, they can be used further. Transpress has incorporated the new volume into its "How it works..." series (so far: D. Endisch: "How the Steam Locomotive Works", BA 4/04; S. Alkofer: "How the Diesel Locomotive Works", BA 8/05 and E. Preuß: "How Railway Signaling Systems Work", BA 1/06), but offers little new compared to the two comparison volumes. Some sections are even based on the older books, with steam locomotives dominating the content. Not even the facilities for electric multiple units, which differ significantly from those for locomotives, for example in S-Bahn or ICE trains, are addressed. Therefore, the book is only recommended if the books mentioned at the beginning are not in stock or replacement purchases are necessary. (2)

Themes and Theses of Critical Social Theory: A Compendium ¤ The book informs about the themes and theses of the older critical theory. From this, the numerous changes and rejections of this project can be assessed. Adorno's theory is in the foreground and it is shown that it is centrally designed as a dialectical social theory, although there are surprising interpretations that operate the dialectic out of Adorno's theory. The central thesis is: Despite all contrary interpretations, criticism can still refer to Adorno with good reasons today. From the older 'Frankfurt School' so many branches have developed in the meantime that it is no longer possible to equate a uniform critical theory with it. This book briefly summarizes the essential themes and theses of the original project. The position of Theodor W. Adorno is emphasized because he has anchored social criticism throughout in a dialectical theory of society, although there are surprising Adorno interpretations today that operate the references to dialectics out of him. A central thesis of this book is: Despite all further developments and fractionalization of the original program, the underlying connection lines to the original project of a dialectical social theory are still preserved in the understanding of 'criticism'.

Voice - Speaking - Language, Therapy, Literature and Art: Festschrift on the 60th Birthday of Marion Hermann-Röttgen ¤ This collection is a tribute to Dr. phil. Marion Hermann-Röttgen M. A. on her 60th birthday. It brings together 26 contributions from renowned and younger authors in logopedics, speech science, speech education, medicine / phoniatrie / orthodontics / dentistry, language and voice therapy, myofunctional therapy, philology, and art science. These articles refer to the broad field of therapy for language, speech, voice, and swallowing disorders, which the jubilarian has dealt with in a versatile way throughout her life, but also to her philological and organizational interests. In accordance with her basic attitude, the contributions illustrate the high rank of interdisciplinary cooperation in the framework of all therapeutic measures and the further-reaching width of the humanistic philosophy of life of Mrs. Hermann-Röttgen

Stalking : [obsessive Harassment and Pursuit, Celebrities and Ordinary Citizens as Stalking Victims, Offender Typologies, Psychological Backgrounds] ; with 8 Illustrations and 12 Tables ¤ Following H. Dreßing's scientific monograph "Stalking!" (ID 37/05), this is another specialist documentation. The forensic psychologist Jens Hoffmann, according to the publisher "the" German stalking expert, presents here the results of his dissertation in an extended form. The content framework is similar to Dreßing's collection (in which Hoffmann was involved), but in differentiation and focus setting further developed. For, in addition to the forms and psychological causes and backgrounds as well as offender and victim typologies and intervention measures, this volume is characterized by special accents: by the presentation of the state of knowledge in intercultural comparison, by the focus on "celebrity stalking", the discussion of the erotomania ("love madness"-)-concept in stalking, the handling of stalking victims and perpetrators as well as special cases: the alleged stalking victim or cyber- (i.e. internet-) stalking. With an opulent bibliography as well as index. - Like Dreßing primarily for scientists and professionals. (3) (Uwe-Friedrich Obsen)

Eskimoland : A Report from the Arctic ¤ Cover -- Title -- Imprint -- Content -- A Word in Advance -- I -- II -- III -- IV -- V -- VI -- VII -- VIII -- IX -- X -- XI -- XII -- XIII -- XIV -- Afterword -- Editorial Note. The ethologist Niko Tinbergen spent 1932/33 fourteen months with the Greenlandic Inuit, who lived at the time as hunters and gatherers. His fascinating report, rediscovered in 2017, still captivates today through the precise observation of people and animals in a hostile environment and is at the same time a lesson in the limitations of the modern European.

Strategies of State and Regional Planning for Coping with Demographic Change: A Project of the Research Programme "General Departmental Research" of the Federal Ministry of Transport, Building and Urban Development (BMVBS) and the Federal Office for Building and Regional Planning (BBR) ¤ In the end, the effects of demographic change play a special role in most federal states in the preparation, revision or reorientation of the spatial development plans. The intensity of dealing with demographic change and the orientation of the strategies and instruments of state planning on the consequences reflect the pressure to act in the countries. The states of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Brandenburg, Saxony-Anhalt, Thuringia, Saxony and Saarland, as well as in partial regions of Rhineland-Palatinate and Lower Saxony, have newly established their state development plans/programs or are in the process of doing so, all with the explicit goal of reacting to the consequences of demographic change in the form of population decline and aging.[...] (Source: BBR)

Rational choice : theoretical analyses and empirical results ; Festschrift for Karl-Dieter Opp on his 70th birthday ¤ In sociology, rational-choice (RC) explanations are increasingly widespread. They are intended to contribute to a solution to general theoretical core problems (explanation of social order, cooperation, and social norms) on the one hand. On the other hand, RC theory now dominates numerous fields of empirical research. In this volume, renowned authors describe the extensive theoretical and empirical application possibilities. A focus of the theoretical works are analyses of social norms. The empirical contributions and applications deal with a broad spectrum of topics, including deviant behavior sociology, political sociology, and terrorism analysis. The essays are rounded off by methodological considerations. The volume provides students and researchers with a comprehensive orientation on the important lines of development of this research program.

From Idea to Text: A Guide to Scientific Writing ¤ The writing of essays, term papers, and final papers is a daunting experience for many students, especially under the time pressure in BA programs: How do I process unmanageable amounts of material in the shortest time? How do I quickly find the right structure and a spark of an idea for my text? What to do when the blank sheet, the empty computer monitor intimidates me so much that my thoughts do not flow freely? Helga Esselborn-Krumbiegel knows all these problems from her long experience in writing seminars with students. Her book leads quickly and safely to the successful scientific text and provides suitable answers for every writing problem

Radically Just: How the Unconditional Basic Income Revolutionizes the Welfare State ¤ Our social system is at an end. It cannot be reformed, says Hamburg economist Professor Thomas Straubhaar. But it can be revolutionized: through the unconditional basic income. If all people, from infants to the elderly, receive a basic income, this does not enslave them, but frees them to self-sufficiency and their own decisions. And the state invests no longer in the administration of scarcity, but in a just equal treatment of all. Sounds too good to be financially feasible? -On the contrary, it is possible, as Straubhaar calculates. The unconditional basic income is a liberal, effective, and social way to bring justice and efficiency to a social system that has gotten out of balance - and thus contribute significantly to inner peace. Germany should dare to try this experiment as one of the largest and most stable economies in the world!

Mediation and Counseling in Practice: An Analysis of Service Processes in the Labor Market ¤ Modern services on the labor market offer and ensure--This is a declared goal of labor market reforms in recent years. In this volume, the mediation and counseling services of agencies and basic security offices are extensively and practically analyzed. Based on observed case histories, interviews, and case-specific documents, the following questions are examined: What are the relevant features of the interaction processes between professionals and customers in mediation conversations? How is customer orientation in mediation and counseling processes? What role do customer needs and expectations play in mediation and counseling? How can mediation and counseling services be improved by involving customers and interest representatives? What are the effects of the results on labor market policy and practice?

Modern Hospital Management : Concepts and Solutions ¤ The future success of many hospitals depends on whether it is possible to satisfactorily care for an increasing number of patients with ever higher expectations of medical progress and treatment quality - in the face of persistent resource scarcity and growing displacement competition.

Psychoanalytic Interpretation and Empirical Methods: On the Way to an Empirically Founded Psychoanalysis ¤ The psychoanalysis not only interprets, it also researches its method. With this, it is on the way to an empirically founded psychoanalysis. Kutter shows in his book how qualitative psychoanalytic interpretation and quantitative empirical research can be constructively connected in a creative approach.

The students learn to know the various confessions, deal with their own confession in the process, but are also motivated to deal with ecumenism and develop their own ideas on how it can be lived on site.

Visual Programming : Fundamentals and Application Possibilities ¤ The book presents the fundamentals of programming with graphical software components in an illustrative way and includes both practical aspects as well as theoretical concepts. Implementing the Environmental Damage Act (ESchadG) Correctly: Recognize Risks and Avoid Liability ¤ Content: Implementing the Environmental Damage Act (ESchadG) Correctly is a perfect introduction to the Environmental Damage Act, which came into force in November 2007. It helps the user to implement the law correctly and avoid mistakes. It shows the effects of the law on him and his work. The brochure is a practical and legally sound introduction to the new law. Through the presentation, the structure and contents of the ESchadG are to be conveyed in a comprehensible manner. In addition, a list of affected functionaries with examples of relevant activities is to enable the assessment of the practical impact. Through the extensive legal materials, interpretation aids are provided. (Publisher's information)

Tourism Architecture Basics ¤ Where the next holiday goes, depends not only on the climate, the landscape and the service in the hotel, but also on the architecture on site. Besides the picturesque old town, the experiential architecture of hotels, museums and shopping malls is primarily in the focus. The book sketches architecture as an economic factor in tourism and deals with the tension between destination management and architecture. The staging and artificial experience worlds, such as in leisure parks, are also taken into account. Urban planning opportunities and risks are also highlighted. Interviews with a hotel manager, an architect and a tourism manager convey the practical perspective to the reader.(Publisher's text)

Europe's Center, Central Europe, European Identity? : History, Literature, Positions ¤ Central Europe is once again in the conversation. The essay collection attempts to critically accompany the renewed recurrence of this historical term using exemplary thematic fields. The history and literature of this historical space are illuminated, and current discussion positions are taken. The focus was on the history of Silesia. The authors of this volume from science and journalism belong to the middle of Europe and see its historical problem without any nostalgia. The volume arose from the eponymous cultural-scientific colloquium of the Europa-Universität Viadrina (Frankfurt/Oder)

Project Management for Dummies : [keep your projects on track from the start ; at a glance: efficiently organize and schedule projects, plan resources and meet the budget, motivate team members to best performance, address risks, plan changes, maintain communication, meet expectations] ¤ In "Project Management for Dummies" shows Stanley Portny how project management really works when you know what to look out for. Portny covers the latest project management techniques and presents various computer programs that support and significantly simplify project management. With this book, everyone becomes a seasoned project manager who masters their projects with ease. Foundations of Quality Management ¤ What is quality? How important is it from the supplier's or manufacturer's point of view? How can it be influenced or even deliberately created? What are the consequences of not meeting quality requirements? This didactically excellent textbook answers these and many other questions around the topic of quality management in a clear and easy-to-follow manner. - Comprehensive introduction to quality management - Excellent didactic construction - Suitable for accompanying lectures and self-study - With control questions and solutions - With numerous examples from industry - Considers ISO 9001:2015 (Publisher's text)

Bioeconomy for Beginners ¤ It is likely to be the first book in the German-speaking region that can be considered a comprehensive guide for entering the bioeconomy. Bioeconomy - this is connected with nothing less than the long-term survival of humanity on this earth. It's about the transition from the age of fossil raw materials to a world economy based on renewable resources. The scientific, ideology-free, and understandable discussion of the natural scientific, economic, and ecological challenges and backgrounds is presented. The numerous authors discuss the questions of biomass and its use, biotechnology and innovation, circular economy and sustainability in the 10 chapters and also discuss problems of economic and consumption growth. The abundance of information makes the reading exciting and interesting, numerous illustrations clarify the relationships. (2-3)

Generationen-Management : Concepts, Instruments, Best-Practice Approaches ¤ Publisher's information: Studies show that companies experience the change in age structure, but also the change in wishes within the workforce as the first consequences of demographic change. Despite this, the priority in demographic management is often still on health promotion and talent acquisition. However, this is not enough to build a competitive workforce sustainably. Leadership and work organization not only determine the working ability, but also the commitment of employees. Systematic generation management creates the framework conditions to position the company as an attractive employer for all relevant employee groups and thus derive competitive advantages from a diversity of generations. In this context, three fields of action appear to be essential: shaping organizational and labor policy framework conditions, promoting lifelong performance capability, and strengthening intergenerational appreciation and cooperation.

In Focus: Natural Resources: In Search of Raw Materials ¤ The collection, created in collaboration with the newly established 'German Raw Materials Agency' and the 'Federal Institute for Geosciences', contains 17 essays and interviews that deal with the impending scarcity of energy raw materials, minerals, and ores. The authors also analyze how Germany, as a country with limited raw materials, can ensure its supply. Although it is not a systematic representation, a wide range of topics are covered. They range from increasingly important rare earths (with 'We're consuming ourselves to death', ID-A 50/11) to the search for unconventional gas fields (on gas 'Energy in 60 minutes', ID-B 46/11) to manganese nodules, diamonds, copper, salt, and coal. In comparison to the conference proceedings 'Energy and Raw Materials' (ID-G 40/11), the essays are easier to read and take into account environmental policy aspects. A color section offers maps and photos. Despite the very high price, the small book, suitable for students, can be recommended after 'We're consuming ...', but before the two other titles. (2 pages)

Physics : Introduction for Engineers and Natural Scientists ; [Extras in the Web] ¤ Ein trockenes Fach is the verdict of most students about physics. With all the more pleasure you will take this textbook in hand, because the author describes the basics of physics briefly, vividly, and precisely. Over 400 illustrations and numerous examples from everyday life promote understanding of physical contents. The didactics developed in dialogue with students is supported by the appealing two-colored layout and facilitates learning. Over 200 exercise questions with answers in the appendix encourage independent engagement with the topic. The work is excellently suitable for preparation for the exam and offers itself as a reference work due to the comprehensive index. In addition, you will find interesting links and understanding questions with commented solutions for download on the author's Internet site. The graphical representations were partially revised. The report is intended as an addition to the current state of knowledge of the oceanography of the German Bight and as a knowledge repository.

Basic Rights ¤ This textbook is aimed at students who either seek an introduction to the field of basic rights or wish to review the basic rights in preparation for exercises and the state examination. The work is consistently tailored to the requirements with which students are confronted in exams, home and study work. All basic rights, including their European law connections, as well as the exam-relevant basic features of the constitutional complaint are systematically derived from the constitutional text. The general basic rights teachings, which are often only difficult to understand in their abstractness, especially for the beginner, are not 'pushed aside' but treated by example of individual basic rights. In order to better understand, the book also reproduces the central decisions of the Federal Constitutional Court in relevant excerpts. Examples, whose solutions are made available over the internet, as well as collections of typical exam problems round off the textbook. (Publisher's advertising)

Superintelligence : Scenarios of a Coming Revolution ¤ Genius that is more developed than human intelligence is called superintelligence. How likely is the construction of machines and computers that are superintelligent, and how could these be controlled by humans? (Harald Pilzer) What happens if scientists one day succeed in developing a machine that surpasses human intelligence in almost all important areas? Clearly: Such a superintelligence would be extremely powerful and would pose us control and management problems, compared to which tackling climate change is child's play. Moreover: Probably, the future of the human species would be in the hands of this superintelligence, just as the future of gorillas depends on us today. Futurism? Or rather science fiction?

Lebensbegleitendes Lernen as Competence Development : Analyses - Concepts - Fields of Action ¤ Lebensbegleitendes Lernen is intertwined with processes of de-limitation and the change of societal and pedagogical relationships. Terms like competence development, informal learning or life guidance work focus the attention on the subjects of education and the potential of self-performance of the learners. This is connected with the question of a learning culture change that also includes educational organizations and their work orientations. Required are innovative adult education, which goes hand in hand with an increasingly rising legitimation need of the pedagogical service offer. For this, terms like quality development or knowledge management are used. Furthermore, the trend of development is highlighted, that the work-world-related and business-related competence development gains weight in the framework of lifelong learning and adult education.

Innovation as a Success Factor : with 7 Tables ¤ Innovations represent a decisive success factor for an entire national economy, a branch, and for each company. Innovations can initially consist of new products, brands, or process innovations. Furthermore, they can be present in the form of social innovations. Even new management techniques can be given. In this collection, innovative approaches can be found for all areas of business management. The contributions come from management specialists of the GSBA Zurich from Europe and the USA. Utopia or Decline: A Guide to the Current Crisis ¤ With his novel 'Undecided' Benjamin Kunkel made a name for himself in Germany. Parallel to his narrative work, Kunkel writes essays for magazines like 'n+1' and 'The Jacobin'. This volume brings together his most important essays on authors like Fredric Jameson, David Graeber and Slavoj Zizek From this emerges not only a panorama of left-wing thinking: By linking the read with his own experiences, Kunkel reflects at the same time on what it means to have grown up in neoliberal times. His youth, so Kunkel, he spent largely during the end of history - which now seems to be coming to an end itself.

Solarthermie : how the sun becomes heat ¤ What contribution can solar thermal energy make to the energy transition? What does solar heat and cooling cost? Where are their limits? After a brief overview of the history of solar thermal energy use, the authors introduce the physical fundamentals of solar radiation. Then they explain the collector and system technology using numerous illustrations. Further chapters illuminate the future development lines (keyword: solar power plant!) and the economic efficiency of this technology. The book also provides a good introduction to the important technology on the way to the energy transition for laypeople.

Methods of Computer Animation ¤ The book is based on a lecture series of the University of Rostock. In detail and thoroughly, classical Keyframe-Animation, direct and inverse kinematics, deformations, morphing, particle and facial animation, modeling and animation of natural phenomena, animation control by neural networks, as well as motion capture and editing are treated. The target group are students of the field of computer science or media technology with a focus on computer graphics or animation, but also programmers who want to familiarize themselves with the basics, methods, and algorithms of computer animation. Similar target groups are also addressed by Michael Bender (ID 51/03), Klaus Zeppenfeld (ID 44/04), or Manfred Klawonn (ID 53/05). For (serious) hobbyists, see Christian Ströh (BA 6/03). (3)

Introduction to Mathematical Work ¤ The way mathematics is taught at higher schools differs radically from the way mathematics is taught at universities. While in school mathematics, mostly schemes for solving standard problems are in the foreground, mathematics as a science is mainly concerned with abstract structures. These are defined by as few basic attributes as possible, and further valid properties as well as cross-references to other structures are derived in proofs by logical conclusions. There is probably hardly a subject where a broader and deeper chasm between school and university has to be overcome, and many students are already at risk of failing in the first weeks at this transition. The "Introduction to Mathematical Work" bridges this chasm by placing the "How" on an equal footing with the "What" in the transmission of the typical contents of the first study phase. The text aims at an understanding of mathematics as a method ... for: mathematics freshmen.

State Failures at the Highest Level: What Must Change After the Mollath Case ¤ Even in the rule of law, there are wrongful judgments and/or isolation of uncomfortable people in forensic psychiatry: This has made the Mollath case clear to a broad public. Especially the internet is full of outrage, revelations, and solidarity. That Mollath was released in August 2013 after 7 years is due to the long efforts of a support group, alone Mollath was defenseless. He wanted to uncover money laundering transactions, was brought to court by defamation, and was classified as a public danger through a fatal collaboration of justice, questionable psychiatric reports, as well as the concealment of economic crime and the failure of politics. In enlightening reports and statements from lawyers, doctors, and engaged journalists, connections, shortcomings, and diagnosis problems are explained, reforms are demanded, and the long way to the re-trial is described (March 2014). Chronology; Notes. - Usable everywhere alongside U. Ritzer (ID-A 27/13) due to even more precise research and expert assessments. (2)

Digitalization in Care: Supporting Better Work Organization ¤ This book systematically focuses on the approaches of digitalization that improve work organization in care and thus have the potential to contribute to higher job satisfaction of care workers. Digitalization in care is currently being very controversially discussed. "Will care workers in the future be replaced by care robots?" Such and similar headlines raise far-reaching ethical questions and do not contribute to making the potential that digitalization offers for the care industry visible. This book deals with approaches to digitalization that support care workers in their daily work or also increase the quality of life of care recipients. The presented approaches were scientifically founded and have proven themselves in practice. The book also shows how the process of digital transformation in care can be successfully implemented - namely in a way that the employees in care are designers of their own change process from the beginning. The editors Dr. Vanessa Kubek is a Diplom-Politologin, graduated in economics at the TU Kaiserslautern and is a systemic consultant (DGSF), systemic coach and organizational developer (SG/DGSF). Dr. Sebastian Velten studied economics and mathematics at the TU Kaiserslautern and graduated in economics at the University of Saarland in Saarbrücken. Since 2008, he has been working as a research assistant at the Fraunhofer Institute for Techno- and Economic Mathematics ITWM. Dr. Frank Eierdanz is a Diplom-Geograph, graduated in psychology at the University of Kassel and has been working as a research assistant at the Institute for Technology and Work in Kaiserslautern since 2009. Annette Blaudszun-Lahm is a Diplom-Pflegewirtin and nurse. Since 2002, she has been working as a research assistant at the Institute for Technology and Work e.V. Roof Stages ¤ Publisher's text: The roof is the primal form of human dwellings, where wood as a building material for roof constructions still holds an enormous significance in residential construction. Due to its low weight, fast assembly, elementarity, and modern connection technology, wooden roof stages will also be used in the future. The book provides an overview of the common construction systems used in old and new buildings, up to special forms, roof dormers, and modern constructions. Similarly, constructive approaches are shown and explained, as well as hints given to analyze the inventory and set constructive measures to enable later roof space use. Furthermore, the principles of roof stiffening are explained and construction proposals are given.

Methods and Instruments of Spatial Planning: Handbook ¤ This foundational work includes individual contributions to methods, procedures, and instruments of spatial planning. The sequence of contributions is oriented towards the individual stages of planning concretization: framework conditions analysis and prognosis-planning decision-plan implementation-control and evaluation. The topics treated range from legal foundations to the presentation of qualitative procedures to the comparison of various planning cases. In addition, possibilities of using computers in the planning process are presented.

Don't be Afraid - Write! : The Hero Method for Home and Thesis Work ¤ Katja Reinicke, independent writing coach and lecturer for scientific writing, presents the 'Hero Method' she developed, which supports students in writing their thesis work. In particular, it is about providing assistance in overcoming writing blocks and fears, in order to find one's way into the writing process and come to a first rough outline of the work. Methods for idea finding and structuring as well as concrete formulation aids are presented. The individual exercise units are set up according to a 'dramaturgy' with concrete scenarios, which each contain a brief introduction, tasks, case examples, and (very detailed) scientific background information. The program is certainly most effective in a writing workshop or in personal writing coaching. - Additionally available in larger quantities alongside classical titles on scientific writing such as Daniela Weber: The Successful Thesis for Dummies (2017). Writing blocks are also discussed by Helga Esselborn-Krumbiegel: Tips and Tricks for Writing Blocks (2015)

Information Behavior in the Choice of Studies and Vocational Training: Eligible Students 2012 Half a Year Before and Half a Year After Graduation ¤ To prepare for studies or training, prospective students eligible for studies mainly consider online offers and personal conversations helpful. Especially popular are easily accessible information sources such as online portals for the choice of studies and vocational training, university or company homepages, as well as print media. In their personal environment, in addition to friends and siblings, parents are important contact partners in matters of education and study planning. In comparison to previous cohorts, students eligible for studies in 2012 inform themselves earlier about the possibilities of studies and vocational training and also rate their information status as more comprehensive half a year before graduation. (HoF/Text adopted)

The Beginner's Seminar - CorelDRAW X4 ¤ CorelDRAW Graphics Suite is a graphics software primarily distributed on Windows systems, which has experienced strong competition from Adobe programs, primarily distributed in the prepress stage, Illustrator and FreeHand, and no longer has the importance of earlier years. This is also evident in the reaction of the book market, as the series title for the previous version X3 by the same authors (BA 10/06) was the only title on the topic that could be discussed here. The new version X4 does not contain fundamental changes compared to X3, yet the predecessor title was carefully revised within the proven series in the learn-practice-apply concept with unchanged structure and above all updated by exchanging screenshots. The scope has increased by around 50 pages, which is partly due to a somewhat more generous layout. The book trade currently offers no alternatives for the new version, so the new purchase is mandatory there where each program version is to be documented, otherwise the predecessor still provides good services. Philosophical Foundations of the Natural Sciences: A Critique of Scientism ¤ The book is an attempt to overcome the dichotomy between the humanities and the natural sciences with a general theory of the mind. Violence in Schools: Pedagogical Answers to a Social Crisis ¤ An up-to-date analysis of the manifestations and causes of violence among students, combined with proposals for pedagogical measures and programs. Iran. Interrupted : . [Trans.: Susanne Baghestani ; Benjamin Carter] ¤ Beatrice Minda (*1968 in Munich) is repeatedly concerned with the relationship between private space, memory, and history. Following the expressive exploration of Romanian interiors in her photo book Innenwelt, the artist travels to the Islamic Republic of Iran for her new work. There, she immerses herself in the largely unknown world of private Persian living spaces and inner courtyards, including their enclosures by grilles, walls, or impenetrable curtains. In a country with a history spanning thousands of years, Beatrice Minda follows the trail of a partially heavily buried tradition and identifies – despite all historical breaks – hidden signs of continuity. In the sensitive color photographs, it becomes visible and tangible how the current mindset of the inhabitants, as well as historical, cultural, and social connections, are reflected in the private space. Subtly, this brings the socio-political dimension of Iran. Interrupted to the fore.

Islam in the Media: Journalistic Quality in the Struggle over the Mohammed Cartoons ¤ Islam has become a top theme in the media in Germany. Almost daily, the German press reports on the integration of Muslims or developments in Muslim-dominated countries. The reporting thus determines the social discourse and decisively influences political debates. Reports without tendentious representations and evaluations are therefore urgently needed. Is there a need for action here? Based on journalistic quality criteria, Fabian Wahl examines the reporting in three German daily newspapers on the example of the dispute over the Mohammed cartoons. With the Süddeutsche Zeitung, the BILD-Zeitung, and the Bonner General-Anzeiger, he covers the entire spectrum from the nationwide quality newspaper to the opinion-forming tabloid to the independent regional newspaper. Empirically, the author checks the aspects of diversity, impartiality, accuracy, transparency, and understandability.

Culture and Pedagogical Reform: On the Relevance of Humanistic Education ¤ This book starts from an analysis of the spiritual situation of the time as the time of transition into a globalized civilization, whose characteristics are the overwhelming economization of all life relationships, the dominance of the natural sciences that are available to humans, the overwhelming technologization of societies, the lack of a European consciousness based on Christian antiquity, and the reduction of human existence to the religious dimension. From there, it is shown that the reforms initiated under the names of PISA and Bologna Process are inadequate to meet the time-conditioned challenges. From there again, it is argued why only a pedagogical reform with the contents of a modern humanism that actualizes traditions is able to equip people to face the immense threats. The connection between culture and education is made clear at the concepts of 'beauty', 'leisure' and 'community sense', at the polarity of pre-Socratic and postmodern, and at the example of Goethe for a lifelong educational effort. The necessary contents of a humanism that shapes all schools at all age levels are described and justified from the spiritual situation of the time. Spatial implications of the European Monetary Union ¤ With the beginning of the year 1999, a further important step towards deeper integration of Europe took place: The European Monetary Union (EMU) was put into force. Undoubtedly, this has, beside other effects, also considerable effects on the economic geography of the integrating area. Possible and probable spatial effects of EMU was the motive to establish an international working group within the ARL-DATAR (Délégation à l'Aménagement du Territoire et à l'Action Régionale) cooperation agreement in order to shed some light on these effects. Squimera : a live, Smalltalk-based IDE for dynamic programming languages ¤ BEGIN Software development tools that work and behave consistently across different programming languages are helpful for developers, because they do not have to familiarize themselves with new tooling whenever they decide to use a new language. Also, being able to combine multiple programming languages in a program increases reusability, as developers do not have to recreate software frameworks and libraries in the language they develop in and can reuse existing software instead. However, developers often have a broad choice with regard to tools, some of which are designed for only one specific programming language. Various Integrated Development Environments have support for multiple languages, but are usually unable to provide a consistent programming experience due to different features of language runtimes. Furthermore, common mechanisms that allow reuse of software written in other languages usually use the operating system or a network connection as the abstract layer. Tools, however, often cannot support such indirections well and are therefore less useful in debugging scenarios for example. In this report, we present a novel approach that aims to improve the programming experience with regard to working with multiple high-level programming languages. As part of this approach, we reuse the tools of a Smalltalk programming environment for other languages and build a multi-language virtual execution environment which is able to provide the same runtime capabilities for all languages. The prototype system Squimera is an implementation of our approach and demonstrates that it is possible to reuse development tools, so that they behave in the same way across all supported programming languages. In addition, it provides convenient means to reuse and even mix software libraries and frameworks written in different languages without breaking the debugging experience. END

The Motel in America ¤ In The Motel in America, John Jakle, Keith Sculle, and Jefferson Rogers take an informative and entertaining look at the history, architecture, and business of motels in the United States. Like Jakle and Sculle's acclaimed The Gas Station in America, this book explores the effect on American culture as citizens became motorists. The new breed of automobile traveler rejected the hotels of the railroad era, which were located in congested downtown areas and lacked adequate parking. Instead, they came to favor the roadside lodgings outside city limits which came to be known as motels, a term first used in Arthur Heineman's Milestone Mo-tel, opened in San Luis Obispo, California, in 1926. The popularity of motels grew steadily throughout the century, booming after the Second World War and reaching a peak in 1961, when there were some 61,000 motels operating throughout the country, the vast majority of them independently owned. These motels were an integral part of the American landscape, shaping their guests' ideas about modern living, introducing Americans to the consumer novelties of the age: color televisions, automatic coffee makers, shag rugs, even residential swimming pools. By the 1980s, most of the country's 40,000 motel establishments were affiliated with referral and franchise chains, reflecting the traveler's need for uniform quality and the entrepreneur's desire for regional or national recognition. The history of the motel, from autocamp to franchise, has long been overlooked. Although motels have come to be taken for granted, they illustrate much that is central to the American experience. In The Motel in America, motels at last receive the careful interpretation they deserve.

Topology of digital images : visual pattern discovery in proximity spaces ¤ This book carries forward recent work on visual patterns and structures in digital images and introduces a near set-based a topology of digital images. In keeping with an interest in gaining an understanding of digital images themselves as a rich source of patterns, this book introduces the basics of digital images from a computer vision perspective. In parallel with a computer vision perspective on digital images, this book also introduces the basics of proximity spaces. The beauty of the descriptive proximity approach is that it is possible to discover visual set patterns among sets that are non-overlapping and non-adjacent spatially. By combining the spatial proximity and descriptive proximity approaches, the search for salient visual patterns in digital images is enriched, deepened and broadened. Interval probabilistic timed graph transformation systems ¤ The formal modeling and analysis is of crucial importance for software development processes following the model based approach. We present the formalism of Interval Probabilistic Timed Graph Transformation Systems (IPTGTSs) as a high-level modeling language. This language supports structure dynamics (based on graph transformation), timed behavior (based on clocks, guards, resets, and invariants as in Timed Automata (TA)), and interval probabilistic behavior (based on Discrete Interval Probability Distributions). That is, for the probabilistic behavior, the modeler using IPTGTSs does not need to provide precise probabilities, which are often impossible to obtain, but rather provides a probability range instead from which a precise probability is chosen nondeterministically. In fact, this feature on capturing probabilistic behavior distinguishes IPTGTSs from Probabilistic Timed Graph Transformation Systems (PTGTSs) presented earlier. Following earlier work on Interval Probabilistic Timed Automata (IPTA) and PTGTSs, we also provide an analysis tool chain for IPTGTSs based on inter-formalism transformations. In particular, we provide in our tool AutoGraph a translation of IPTGTSs to IPTA and rely on a mapping of IPTA to Probabilistic Timed Automata (PTA) to allow for the usage of the Prism model checker. The tool Prism can then be used to analyze the resulting PTA w.r.t. probabilistic real-time queries asking for worst-case and best-case probabilities to reach a certain set of target states in a given amount of time.

Set-valued mappings and enlargements of monotone operators ¤ Set-valued analysis is an essential tool for the mathematical formulation of many real-life situations, e.g., equilibrium theory in mathematical economics. This work offers the first comprehensive treatment in book form of the fairly new subdiscipline of enlargements of maximal monotone operators, including several important new results in the field. In the last decades, with the development of nonsmooth optimization, effective algorithms have been developed to solve these kinds of problems, such as nonsmooth variational inequalities. Several of these methods, such as bundle methods for variational problems, are fully developed and analyzed in this book. The first chapters provide a self-contained review of the basic notions and fundamental results in set-valued analysis, including set convergence and continuity of set-valued mappings together with many important results in infinite-dimensional convex analysis, leading to the classical fixed point results due to Ekeland, Caristi and Kakutani. Next, an in-depth introduction to monotone operators is developed, emphasizing results related to maximality of subdifferentials and of sums of monotone operators. Building on this foundational material, the second part of the monograph contains new results (all of them established during the last decade) on the concept of enlargements of monotone operators, with applications to variational inequalities, bundle-type methods, augmented Lagrangian methods, and proximal point algorithms

A perturbation result for dynamical contact problems ¤ This paper is intended to be a first step towards the continuous dependence of dynamical contact problems on the initial data as well as the uniqueness of a solution. Moreover, it provides the basis for a proof of the convergence of popular time integration schemes as the Newmark method. We study a frictionless dynamical contact problem between both linearly elastic and viscoelastic bodies which is formulated via the Signorini contact conditions. For viscoelastic materials fulfilling the Kelvin-Voigt constitutive law, we find a characterization of the class of problems which satisfy a perturbation result in a non-trivial mix of norms in function space. This characterization is given in the form of a stability condition on the contact stresses at the contact boundaries. Furthermore, we present perturbation results for two well-established approximations of the classical Signorini condition: The Signorini condition formulated in velocities and the model of normal compliance, both satisfying even a sharper version of our stability condition.

Quantum entropy and its use ¤ This book provides a complete overview of quantum entropy theory, from the early days of quantum mechanics up to the most recent developments. Econometric Theory and Methods ¤ Econometric Theory and Methods provides a unified treatment of modern econometric theory and practical econometric methods. The geometrical approach to least squares is emphasized, as is the method of moments, which is used to motivate a wide variety of estimators and tests. Simulation methods, including the bootstrap, are introduced early and used extensively. The book deals with a large number of modern topics. In addition to bootstrap and Monte Carlo tests, these include sandwich covariance matrix estimators, artificial regressions, estimating functions and the generalized method of moments, indirect inference, and kernel estimation. Every chapter incorporates numerous exercises, some theoretical, some empirical, and many involving simulation. Econometric Theory and Methods is designed for beginning graduate courses. The book is suitable for both one- and two-term courses at the Masters or Ph.D. level. It can also be used in a final-year undergraduate course for students with sufficient backgrounds in mathematics and statistics. FEATURES BLUnified Approach: New concepts are linked to old ones whenever possible, and the notation is consistent both within and across chapters wherever possible. BLModern Concepts Introduced Early: These include the bootstrap (Chapter 4), sandwich covariance matrices (Chapter 5), and artificial regressions (Chapter 6). BLInclusive Treatment of Mathematics: Mathematical and statistical concepts are introduced as they are needed, rather than isolated in appendices or introductory chapters not linked to the main body of the text. BLAdvanced Topics: Among these are models for duration and count data, estimating equations, the method of simulated moments, methods for unbalanced panel data, a variety of unit root and cointegration tests, conditional moment tests, nonnested hypothesis tests, kernel density regression, and kernel regression. BLChapter Exercises: Every chapter offers numerous exercises, all of which have been answered by the authors in the Instructor's Manual. Decreasing costs of renewables : analysis of energy sector planning and climate policy in Indonesia ¤ This study analyses the processes and assumptions underlying the development of Indonesia's NDC and its revision in 2020. The assumptions underlying the related energy sector documents (KEN, RUEN, RUKN, RUPTL) and their relationships are also assessed. The study is completed by giving a snapshot of the current state of discussion around constraints related to renewable energy. The unconditional target of Indonesia's NDC foresees a reduction of GHG emissions of 29% relative to a Business-as-Usual (BAU) scenario (41% conditional to international support). It specifies that electricity generation shall reduce emissions by 18.8% relative to BAU. The overall target of a 29% and 41% have been set by a non-public process. The sectoral shares of GHG reductions are determined by the responsible ministries (ESDM in case of the energy sector), with modelling performed by academic institutions (e.g. BTI for energy). This modelling is partly based on existing plans of the energy sector. Data underlying this modelling is not public, but underlying socio-economic assumptions suggest that the BAU scenario overestimates emissions. The NDC has no influence on planning in the energy sector but should be considered a by-product of existing planning documents. The process underlying the current revision is repeated for the current revision of the NDC and likely also for creation of the LTS. The ambition under the revised NDC will not be increased. The share of renewable energy in the NDC follows from a cascade of energy planning documents (KEN, RUEN, RUKN, RUPTL), which pass the target from the most overarching energy plans to the NDC. Arguably the most important target related to renewable energy planning in Indonesia set down by the countries' energy strategy KEN, to reach 23% renewable energy in each sector in total primary energy supply in 2025. The assumptions underlying this target are not known and can therefore not be contested. The national energy plan RUEN makes this target more specific in terms of technology. The power sector plan by the ministry of energy RUKN and the power sector plan by the utility RUPTL all consider 23% renewable energy target. Besides that, these plans remain largely disconnected from each other...

Beneficial uses and production of isotopes ¤ Radioactive and stable isotopes are used throughout the world and in many sectors, including medicine, industry, agriculture and research. This publication is the first international survey on the beneficial uses and production of isotopes.
